src: Tabbata cewa hannunku suna a sake yayin da kake bugun kiɗa daidai - kuma yi ƙoƙarin kada kuyi motsin ɗage da yatsunku. Ta wannan hanyar, za ku gajiyar da kanku kamar kaɗan daidai gwargwado. Ku tuna cewa babu buƙatar a bugi makullin da ƙarfi sosai don ƙarin murya kamar akan fiyano. A accordion, domin samun karin yawa, ka yi amfani da mabushi da ƙarfi ko sauri.
mt: It is known that your hands are in the right place while playing - and try to prevent your fingers from moving too fast. By this method, you will play like a pro. Remember that there is no need to play loudly for more volume like on a piano. On an accordion, to get more volume, use the bellows or fast.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Daya daga cikin matsalolin da aka fi sani yayin kokarin juya fim zuwa tsarin DVD shine overscan. Yawancin telebijin ana yin su ne ta hanyar da za ta faranta wa jama'a rai. Bisa wannan dalilin, dukkan wani abu da ka gani a Telebijin an yanyanke shi daga ta sama da kasa da kuma gefensa. Ana yin wannan don tabbatar da cewa hoton ya rufe dukkan allo. Wannan shi ake kira overscan. Abun takaici, idan kayi DVD, ana iya yanka iyakokin ta, kuma idan bidiyon suna da jerin kalmomin suna kusa da kasa, ba za a nuna su gabaɗaya ba.
mt: One of the most common problems when converting a film to a DVD format is overscan. Most televisions are made to be viewed from a distance. For this reason, everything you see on the screen is cropped from the top and bottom and sides. This is called overscan. The problem is, when you play a DVD, you can crop the edges off, and if the subtitles are at the bottom, you won't see them at all.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Amurka ta dogara da shirin ta na kai hari a jere daga sassa uku daban-daban. Janar John Cadwalder zai kaddamar da harin wuce gona da iri kan rundunar sojojin Burtaniya a Bordentown, don toshe duk wani karfafawa. Janar James Ewing zai dauki mayaƙai 700 a hayin Kogin Trenton Ferry, kwace gada ta Assunpink Creek kuma ta hana duk wasu sojojin abokan gaba tserewa. Babbar rundunar farmakin mai dakaru 2,400 za ta ƙetara kogin a daidai mil 9 a arewacin Trenton, sannan su kasu gida biyu, ɗaya ƙarƙashin Greene da kuma ɗayan ƙarƙashin Sullivan, domin kai farmaki kafin asuba.
mt: The United States is relying on a three-pronged attack. Major John Cadwalder will lead a raid across the river from the British Army in Bordentown, to cut off all retreat. Major James Ewing will take 700 men across the Trenton River Ferry, seize the Assunpink Creek bridge and block any British advance. The main artillery battery of 2,400 will cross the river at mile 9 north of Trenton, then split into two, one under Greene and the other under Sullivan, to open fire before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Bayan Majalisar wakilai ta amince da shi a ranar 4 ta Yuli, sa'an nan aka aika wani daftarin da aka rubuta da hannu wanda Shugaban Majalisar John Hancock ya sa hannu da ɗan nesa zuwa ga shagon buga rubutu na John Dunlap. Cikin daren an buga tsakanin 150 da 200 wanda aka fi sani da “Dunlap Broadsides”. John Nixon ne ya yi karatun farko na daftarin a bainar jama’a cikin filin Independence Hall a ranar 8 ga watan Yuli. An aika ma George Washington ɗaya a ranar 6 ga Yuli, wanda ya karanta ma sojojinsa a New York ranar 9 ga Yuli. Wani kwafi ya isa Landan a ranar 10 ga watan Agusta. Manyan bangarori 25 na Dunlap da har yanzu aka san sun wanzu sune mafi thufan kwafin rubutattun takardun. Kwafin rubutun hannun na asali ya salwanta.
mt: 4 July, the House of Representatives approved it, and the next day, John Hancock signed it and sent it to the printer John Dunlap. That night, about 150 to 200 copies were printed, known as “Dunlap Broadsides”. John Nixon read the first copy publicly in Independence Hall on 8 July. George Washington received his copy on 6 July, and read it to his troops in New York on 9 July. A copy reached London on 10 August. Most of the 25 known Dunlap broadsides are in poor condition, and the original manuscript is damaged.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: ‘Yan kama-wuri-zaunan, ganin wanna lamarin, sun nemi karin taimako.. Runduna dake sahun matsayar gaba sun hada da dakaru na 1 da na 3 daga rundunar New Hampshire rajimantin maza 200, karkashin shugabancin Kanar John Stark da James Reed (dukkansu daga baya sun zama Janar). Mutanen Stark suka ja daga a jikin shingen ta karshen arewacin inda Colonist suka tsaya. Lokacin da karamin tashin ruwa ta bude rata daidai da Kogin Sufi wato Mystic River kusa da arewa maso gabas na mashigin teku, sun hanzarta shimfiɗa shinge tare da ɗan gajeren bangon dutse zuwa arewa wanda ke ƙare da gefen ruwa a karamin bakin teku. Gridley ko Stark sun sanya gungumen da ke kusa da ƙafa 100 (mita 30) a gaban katangar kuma suka ba da umarnin cewa babu wanda zai yi wuta har sai masu doka sun wuce shi.
mt: 1st and 3rd New Hampshire Regiments, under the command of Col. John Stark and James Reed (both later became Generals), were stationed on the hilltop. Stark's men advanced from behind a stone wall at the river's edge, where the river was crossed by a small dam. Gridley or Stark placed a guard of about 100 yards (30 m) in front of the dam and ordered that no one should fire until the law had passed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Ƙasar China ta zamanin da tana da wata hanyar musamman ta nuna lokutan yanayi daban-daban; kowane mataki na China ko kowane iyali da ya hau karagar mulki to shi ma daula ce ta daban. Haka nan tsakanin kowace daula a kan sami lokaci na rashin zaman lafiya tsakanin larduna. Fitacce daga waɗannan zamuna shi ne zamanin Masarautu Uku da ya faru tsawon shekaru 60 tsakanin Daular Han da ta Jin. A wancan lokaci yaki ya barke tsakanin mafi yawan gidajen sarauta da ke hankoron kujerar sarki. Masarauta Uku ya kasance daya daga cikin zamunan da aka fi zub da jini a tarihin Tsohuwar China dubban mutane sun mutu suna gwagwarmaya don zama a kan madaukakiyar kujera a babbar fada a Xi’an.
mt: China has had a special way of showing different times of weather; every dynasty or family that took over the throne is a different dynasty. Between each dynasty there is a period of unrest between the majority of the palaces that are vying for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods in the history of Ancient China with thousands dying in the struggle for the throne in the capital of Xi’an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Sojojin tururuwa suna tafiya da mazauni a matakai daban-daban kuma. A farko jigilarsu, gungun kwarin na sintiri ne da daddare sai da rana su huta. Mulkin mallaka ya fara matakin makiyaya lokacin da wadatar abinci ya ragu. A wannan lokacin, mulkin mallaka yana yin gidajan wucin gadi waɗanda ake canza su yau da kullun. Kowane ɗaya daga waɗannan har-hare ko tafiyar baroro tana ɗaukar kimanin kwanaki 17.
mt: Troops are deployed at different stages and. Initially their camp, a group of tents in the snow, then they stop. The occupation begins the siege phase when food rations decrease. At this time, the occupation is building temporary shelters which are constantly being changed. Each of these or the march of the barrows takes about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: An lura cewa yawancin tsarukan yadda jiki ke aiki da kuma halayya sun dogara ne da samuwar zangogi yadda abubuwa ke juyawa wadanda agogunan jiki ke samarwa. sauti na lokaci-lokaci, wanda ba su martani ga alamu na yanayi, an kayyade su don hallitu masu rai har da kwayoyin cuta, da fungi da tsirai, da dabbobi. Halittun jikin mutum sune suke ci gaba da wanzuwa a yayin da mutum ke gudu ko da ba tare da wasu abubuwa daga waje/gefe.
mt: It is known that most of the mechanisms by which the body works and behaves depend on the presence of feedback loops, where the body's responses to changes in the environment are measured. The human body is constantly adapting to movement or other external stimuli.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Yawan jama'a yana nufi tarin halittu na wani jinsi na musamman a cikin wani keɓaɓɓen wurin ƙasa. Idan mutane a cikin yawan jama'a suka zama iri daya dangane da wani irin dabi'a na musamman wato phynotypic trait ana kiran su monomorphic. Lokacin da ɗaiɗaikun mutane suka nuna mabambantan nau’uka masu yawa na wata keɓaɓɓiyar ɗabi’a su masu banbanin ƙwayar halitta ne.
mt: A population is said to be monomorphic if all individuals in the population share a particular phenotypic trait. When individuals in a population exhibit a wide range of phenotypes of a particular trait, the population is said to be polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Yawon shakatawa na yanayi yana jan hankalin mutane masu sha'awar ziyartar yankuna na asali don jin daɗin shimfidar wuri, gami da tsirrai da dabbobin daji. Misalin ire-iren ayyukan sun hada farauta, kama kifi, yin hoto, kallon tsuntsaye da kuma ziyartar wurin hutawa da kuma koyan ilimi game da labarin muhallin. Alal misali, shi ne ziyara da daukar hoto da kuma koyon abubuwan a Borneo.
mt: Nature tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas to enjoy the beauty of the land, including rivers and wildlife. Examples include fishing, photography, bird watching, visiting a campsite and learning about the environment. For example, it is a visit and photography and learning about things in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: A kowace safiya, mutane na barin ƙananan garuruwan karkara a motoci don zuwa wuraren ayyukan su kuma wasu da idan suka bari ne wajen aikin su na wuce su. A cikin wannan na’urar sufuri mai sauyawa kowa na da alaka da juna tare da tallafawa, tsarin sufuri ne wanda ya dogara da motocin daidaikun mutane. Ilimin kimiyya yanzu ya nuna cewa wannan babban tattalin arzikin carbon ya lalata biosphere daga ɗayan ƙasashe masu tabbatacce waɗanda suke tallafawa cigaban ɗan adam shekaru miliyan biyu da suka gabata.
mt: At every step, people are leaving small rural towns in cars to go to work and others are staying behind their work to pass by. In this mode of transportation everyone is connected with each other with supporting, transportation system that relies on cars. Science now shows that this major carbon economy has depleted biosphere from one of the countries that are supporting human development for the past two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Ana ganin atom ɗin a matsayin muhimmin abun da ke gina duk wani abu. Abu ne mai matuƙar wuyar sha’ani da ya haɗa da, bisa ga sassauƙan tsarin Bohr, na tsakiyar nucleus wanda electrons suka zagaye, ya yi kama da taurarin da ke kewaye da rana - duba Hoto na 1.1. Tsakiya kwayar halittar ta kunshi abubuwa guda biyu-yayan kwayoyin zarra mara cajin lantarki da mai caji karbar wuta. Protons na dauke da cajin wutan lantarki mafi soyuwa yayin da ita Neutron bata dauke da wutan lantarki. Electrons suna da cajin wutan lantarki mummuna.
mt: Ƙididdigar ɗan adam ɗin a matsayin muhimmin abun da ke gina duk wani abu. Abu ne mai matuƙar wuyar sha’ani da ya haɗa da, bisa ga sassauƙan tsarin Bohr, na tsakiyar nucleus wanda electrons suka zagaye, ya yi kama da taurarin da ke kewaye da rana - duba Hoto na 1.1. Tsakiya kwayar halittar ta kunshi abubuwa guda biyu-yayan kwayoyin zarra mara cajin lantarki da mai caji karbar wuta. Protons na dauke da cajin wutan lantarki mafi soyuwa yayin da ita Neutron bata dauke da wutan lantarki. Electrons suna da cajin wutan lantarki mummuna.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Kusan duk kwamfutoci da ake amfani da su a yau sun dogara ne akan iya sarrafa bayanai wanda ake rufewa a sigar tagwayen lambobi. Lambar binary na iya samun ɗaya daga darajoji biyu, misali 0 ko 1, kuma waɗannan lambobin ana kiransu da lambobin binary - ko guntaye, in za a yi amfani da yaren kwamfuta.
mt: 99% of the computers in use today rely on the ability to interpret data that is being read in binary digits. A binary digit can be either a 0 or a 1, and these digits are called bits.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Shafukan yanar gizo na gulmace-gulmace na iya taimakawa inganta rubuce-rubucen ɗalibai. Yayinda ɗalibai kan fara kwarewar su ta yanar gizo tare da lafuzza mara kyau da rubutu, kasancewar masu sauraro gabaɗaya suna canza hakan. Tun da dalibai sune galibin wadanda suka ziyartar shafi, mawallafin shafin intanet lallai ne ya yi kokarin inganta salon rubutunsa saboda gujewa suka. Har yanzu a wallafar ta shafin intanet “ya saka dalibin kara farga da lamuran duniyar da suke rayuwa ciki.” Bukatar biyan bukatun masu sauraronsu yana saka daliban kaimin zama masu wayo da kuma sha’awarsu (Toto, 2004). Rubutun ra'ayin kanka a yanar gizo kayan aiki ne wanda ke karfafa hadin gwiwa, da ƙarfafa dalibai don faɗaɗa koyin karatu sosai fiye da ranar makaranta ta al'ada. Amfani da ingantacciyar hanyar amfani da yanar gizo “na iya ba da ƙarfi ga ɗalibai su zama masu zurfin bincike da mahimmanci; ta hanyar ba da amsa da sauri game da kayan yanar gizo, ɗalibai na iya ayyana matsayinsu a cikin mahallin sauran rubuce-rubucen tare kuma da fitar da nasu hangen nesa kan wasu batutuwan musamman (Oravec, 2002).
mt: Weblogs can help improve students' writing. While students are beginning to write with the computer, overall they are changing this. As students are the majority of those who visit the site, the webmaster is likely to try to improve his writing because of the fear of being ignored. The desire to satisfy the needs of their readers makes them (Toto, 2004). The writing of the opinion in the web site is a tool that encourages cooperation, and encourages students to expand their learning beyond the usual school day. The use of an advanced web site "may give students the power to be critical and important; by giving quick responses to web sites, students can identify their position in the writing of others and also to project their own views on specific issues (Oravec, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Hanyar Sadarwar ta asynchronous tana ƙarfafa lokacin yin tunani da kuma samun damar amsa wa wasu. Yana ba wa dalibai daman yin aiki cikin hanzarinsu da iyakance hanzarinsu na kayan koyarwa da bayani. Bugu da kari, akwai karancin takunkumin lokaci tare da yiwuwar sassaucin lokutan aiki. (Bremer, 1998) Yin amfani da intanet da yanar gizo yana bawa masu koyon samun dama ga bayyanai a kowane lokaci. Dalibai na iya gabatar da tambayoyi ga malamai a kowane lokaci na rana kuma suyi tsammanin amsoshi cikin gaggawa, maimakon jiran har sai ganawa ta gaba da gaba.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows for thinking time and the ability to respond to others. It provides students with the opportunity to ask questions of teachers at any time of day and respond to them quickly, rather than waiting until the next class meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Ginin tarihin gargajiyar na ta dade da yin yi wahayi zuwa ga tunanin, tattaro hotunan abubuwan ban sha'awa, bukukuwa da jarumta na Arthurian. Ko da a tsaye a cikin shekaru dubu da suka lalace yana da sauƙi mu tuna da sautuna da ƙanshi na fadace-fadace da dadewa, don kusan jin murfin motsi a kan cobbles kuma ku ji tsoron fargabar tashin daga cikin ramin. Shin tunaninmu kuwa ya dogara a kan zahirin al’amari? Ina dalilin da aka fara gina manyan gudajen sarauta tun asali? ta yaya aka tsara kuma aka gina su?
mt: The long history of the legend is full of allusions to the past, the collection of strange images, feasts and jousts of Arthurian. Even though it has faded in the centuries, it is easy to remember the sound and smell of the fairs and the fear of the fall from the ramparts. Is our memory based on the assumption of the events? Why were the great tournaments built from the beginning? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Kamar yadda ya ke a zamanin, Fadar Kirby Muxloe Castle yafi kama zagayayyen gida maimakon haƙiƙar fada. Tagoginsa da ke liƙe da gilashi da siraran katangu ba za su iya jure wani shiryayyen hari na dogon lokaci ba. A cikin 1480s, lokacin da Lord Hastings ya fara ginin, ƙasar ta kasance cikin kwanciyar hankali kuma ana buƙatar kariya ne kawai daga ƙananan ƙungiyoyin masu satar hanya.
mt: As it was in the past, Kirby Muxloe Castle's moat is more of a decorative feature than a defensive one. Its drawbridge and portcullis are only for show, not for stopping a sustained long-term siege. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began construction, the site was in a state of peace and only needed protection from small groups of highwaymen.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Da samun sauyi daga kwatan gudun rabin mil guda, batun gudu ya zama maras muhimmanci sosai yayin da jajircewa kuma ya zama wani abu na lallai. Tabbas mai tseren rabin mil ta lamba daya, mutumin da zai iya kure minti biyu, dole ne ya mallaki saurin gudu, amma dole ne a sami juriya a kowane haɗari. Wasu tseren ƙetare-ƙasa a lokacin hunturu, haɗe tare da aikin motsa jiki na ɓangaren sama na jiki, shine mafi kyawun shiri don lokacin gudu.
mt: After a few miles of running, the act of running becomes less important as the body warms up and becomes a matter of routine. A runner who can run a mile in eight minutes, a person who can run two minutes, must maintain a running speed, but must be alert at every hazard. Some cross-country running in the winter, combined with the upper body exercise of arm swinging, is the best regimen for running time.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Tsarin abinci mai kyau kawai ba zai iya samar da ƙwazon fitattun mutane ba, amma suna iya tasiri sosai ga lafiyar 'yan wasa matasa gaba daya. Kula da ƙoshin lafiya da daidaituwar karfin jiki, yin ɗabi'a mai kyau game da shayarwa, da fahimtar abubuwa daban-daban na ayyukan haɓaka na iya taimaka wa 'yan wasa su inganta ayyukansu kuma su ƙara jin daɗin wasanni.
mt: A healthy diet alone won't make all-star athletes, but it can have a big impact on the health and strength of young players. Good habits about eating, drinking and training can help players improve their performance and enjoy the game more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Matsakaicin gudun nesa wasa ne mara tsada; Koyaya, akwai ra'ayoyi da yawa game da ƙananan kayan aikin da ake buƙata don shiga. Za a iya siyan kaya kamar yadda ake bukata,amma yawanci zasu zama marasa fa’ida kadan ko sosai akan aikin. Ƴan wasan motsa jiki na iya jin cewa sun fi son wani kaya ko da ba shi da wani ainihin amfani.
mt: The average player is not a pro; however, there are many opinions about the small tools needed to enter. You can buy the tools you need, but most will be useless or useless on the job. The player can say that they prefer a tool even if it has no real use.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRI ya danganta ne ga faruwar kimiyyar lissafi da ake kira rawar makaman nukiliya wato Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR), wanda Felix Bloch ya gano a shekarun 1930 (yayin da ya ke aiki a Jami’ar Stanford) da Edward Purcell (daga Jami’ar Harvard). A wannan jijjigar, sararin maganaɗiso da kuma sautin rediyo suna sanya ƙwayoyin zarra su ba da ƙananan sigina na rediyo. A shekara ta 1970, Raymond Damadian, likita kuma masanin kimiyya mai bincike, ya gano madogarar amfani da hton rawar magnet wato magnetic resonance imaging a matsayin kayan aiki don gano cuta a asibiti. Bayan shekaru hudu an ba da izini lambar mallakar kira, wanda shi ne farkon lambar kira a duniya da aka bayar a cikin fannin MRI. A shekarar 1977 ne, Dr. Damadian ya kammala aikin kirkirar na’urar MRI ta farko a tarihi, wadda ya kira da “gagara misali”.
mt: MRI was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch while working at Stanford University and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this discovery, the magnetic fields and radio frequencies cause the nuclei to emit radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a physician and researcher, discovered the use of a magnetic resonance imaging machine as a diagnostic tool for disease in hospitals. After four years, he was granted a patent, which was the first patent in the world for MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first MRI machine in history, which he called the "prototype".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: 'Yan Adam sun fi kowane nau'in halittu da baiwa a cikin karatun zuciyar wasu. Ma'ana shine muna iya hasashe daidai game da abinda wasu mutane ke iya tsinkaya, ko su ke nufi, ko imani da shi ko su ka sani ko kuma su ke muradi. Daya daga cikin baiwar shine, fahimtar abin da wasu mutane ke nufi yana da matuƙar muhimmanci. Yana ba mu damar warware rikitattun al’amura na ayyukan zahiri da wasu su ka aikata. Misali, idan kaga wani yana fasa tagar mota, za ka yi tsammani ya na kokarin sace motar wani ne. Ya kamata a yi masa adalci kasancewar ya jefar da mukullan motarsa ne sakamakon haka ya ke kokarin balle kofar motar tasa.
mt: Humans are more similar to other animals in their brains than in any other organ. This means we can empathize with what other people are feeling, or what they mean, or believe, or know, or desire. One of the ways this manifests is that we are able to overcome the biases of our direct experience and the actions of others. For example, if a dog is barking at a car, you will likely assume the dog is trying to steal the car, not that the car is trying to steal the dog.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: 'Yan Adam sun fi kowane nau'in halittu da baiwa a cikin karatun zuciyar wasu. Ma'ana shine muna iya hasashe daidai game da abinda wasu mutane ke iya tsinkaya, ko su ke nufi, ko imani da shi ko su ka sani ko kuma su ke muradi. Daya daga cikin baiwar shine, fahimtar abin da wasu mutane ke nufi yana da matuƙar muhimmanci. Yana ba mu damar warware rikitattun al’amura na ayyukan zahiri da wasu su ka aikata. Misali, idan kaga wani yana fasa tagar mota, za ka yi tsammani ya na kokarin sace motar wani ne. Ya kamata a yi masa adalci kasancewar ya jefar da mukullan motarsa ne sakamakon haka ya ke kokarin balle kofar motar tasa.
mt: Humans are more similar to other animals in their brains than in any other organ. This means we can empathize with what other people are feeling, or what they mean, or believe, or know, or desire. One of the ways this manifests is that we are able to overcome the biases of our direct experience and the actions of others. For example, if a dog is barking at a car, you will likely assume the dog is trying to steal the car, not that the car is trying to steal the dog.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Kodayake AI yana da ƙarfin ƙarin ma'anar almara ta kimiyya, AI ya kasance wani reshe na kimiyyar kwamfuta mai matuƙar muhimmanci, da ke mu'amala da halayya, koyo da kuma shigar da fasahar ƙwaƙwalwa a cikin inji. Bincike a kan na’urorin mutum mutumi ya jibanci saka na’urori aiki wanda ke bukatar basira kafin aikata su. Misalai sun hada da sarrafawa, shiryawa da tanadi, iya amsa tambayoyi da ganewar asali na abokan ciniki, tare da gane rubutun hannu, murya da fuska. Irin waɗannan abubuwa sun zama horo daban, waɗanda ke mai da hankali kan samar da mafita ga matsalolin rayuwa. Yawacin lokuta ana amfani da tsarin AI a bangarorin tattalin arziki, likitanci, injiniya da sojoji, kamar yadda aka gina cikin ɗimbin komfuta na gida da bidiyon softwaya na mahanjar wasa.
mt: While AI has the potential for greater scientific understanding, AI is a branch of computer science of great importance, dealing with behavior, learning and the incorporation of artificial intelligence into systems. Examples include accounting, forecasting and scheduling, answering questions and recognizing handwriting, speech and faces. These are all separate, but focus on creating tools for real-life problems. Most cases use AI in economic, medical, engineering and military applications, as in the billions of home computers and video game software.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Tsarin tunani mai canzawa dabaru ne na warware matsaloli waɗanda ke haɗa ra'ayoyi daban-daban ko fannoni don nemo mafita. Abinda tunaninka zai mai da hankali kai su ne, sauri, fikira da dacewa, tabbatar da gaskiyar zance, sake yin amfani da dabaru da ake da su na tattara bayanai. Abu mafi mahimmanci a wannan tunanin shine: amsa guda daya ce kawai ta ke daidai. Kuna tunanin amsoshi biyu ne kawai, su ne daidai ne ko ba daidai ba. Irin wannan tunanin ana nasabta shi ne da wani tsarin kimiyya ko kuma tabbatattun tsare-tsare. Mutane masu irin wannan tunanin na da basirar tunani, suna iya hardace tsari, su warware matsaloli kuma su yi aiki akan gwaje-gwajen kimiyya.
mt: A creative thinking process is a way of overcoming problems by combining different ideas or approaches to find solutions. You think of two answers, they are either correct or incorrect. This kind of thinking is associated with a scientific or proven method. People with this kind of thinking have a creative mind, they can overcome problems and work on scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Amfani da rikodin bidiyo ya haifar da bincike mai mahimmanci a cikin fassara bayanan fuska, motsin fuska waɗanda ba sa wuce lokaci ƙalilan. Musamman ma kamar, ikirarin da ya yi cewa zai gano ko mutum yana karyar fassarar/fahimtar kananan maganganu yadda suke. A cikin takardar shi mai take Jawabin Shugaba Oliver Sacks ya bayyana yadda mutane dake fuskantar masala wajen fahimtar jawabi bisa ga masalar tabin kwakwalwa, yace duk da haka suna iya fahimtar gaskiya daidai. Har ma yana ba da shawarar cewa irin waɗannan damar a fassara halayen mutane za su iya rabawa ta dabbobi kamar su karnukan gida.
mt: Using video recordings allowed for important analysis of the timing of head and eye movements that are not possible in real time. In particular, claims that it can detect whether a person is comprehending or not as they read sentences. In a letter from President Oliver Sacks it is stated that people with reading difficulties can understand the truth correctly. It also suggests that these abilities can be taught to animals such as dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Yadda damar samun ilimi da koyo ke canzawa kamar yadda a ka ambata a sama, tushen samun ilimin ya canza. Matakin neman bayanin ya bambanta. yanzu babu sauran matsin lambar tunawa tare da mutum guda ya tuna, sai dai damar iya tuno rubutu ta zama akan maida hankali. A takaice dai, sabon ilimin ya yi matukar tasiri wajen sauyi a yadda ake tafiyar da koyo da kuma yada ilimi.
mt: As you have noted above, the ability to obtain education and training is changing. The level of seeking information is different. Now there is no other way to remember a person except for the ability to remember writing, which is becoming more and more focused. Indeed, new education has had a great impact on how to conduct training and spread education.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Yanar gizo ta hada abubuwa biyu na sadarwar tsakanin al’umma da daidaikun mutane. Kyakyawan halaye na intanet suna haifar da karin girma dangane da matakan gamsarwa. Alal misali, “koyo” da “cudanya” ana kallonsu a matsayin muhimman hanyoyin ƙarfafa yin amfani da yanar gizo (James et al., 1995). “Shiga cikin mutum” da “ci gaba da dangantaka” na cikin sabbin fannonin kwarin gwiwa ta Eighmey da McCord (1998) yayinda suka bincika daukin masu sauraro a gidajen yanar gizo.
mt: 1. A website is a combination of two things: interactivity and information. The best features of the internet are the ones that encourage people to use it. For example, "browse" and "search" are considered to be the most important ways to access the internet (James et al., 1995). "Enter the person" and "continue the relationship" are new forms of empathy in Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they studied the adoption of users in the internet.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Tsarin Gothic ya yi shura a tsakankanin karni na 10 zuwa na 11 da kuma karni na 14. A farkon lamari, kabilar Byzantine da ke gabashi ta karfafa saka tufafi. Koyaya, saboda saurin tashoshin sadarwa, salo a yamma na iya zama baya zuwa shekara 25 zuwa 30. a karshen karnin tsakiya sashin nahiyar turai na yamma ta fara bunkasa nata tsarin. Daya daga cikin abubuwan da aka gina a wannan lokacin da taimakon ‘yan jihadi shine fara amfani da anini don rike riga.
mt: 10th to 11th century Gothic architecture was influenced by the Byzantine Empire to the east. However, due to the rapid spread of communication, the west may have been behind by 25 to 30 years. In the middle of the century, the western hemisphere began to develop its own style. One of the innovations of this period was the use of arches to support vaults.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Za mu iya fara zaman nuna sabo ga muhalli, za mu iya shiga cikin yunƙurin inganta muhalli, kuma mu kan iya zama ‘yan gwagwarmaya don rage wahala nan gaba a wani mataki. Wannan kamar magani ne na alamun cuta a lokuta da yawa. Koyaya, idan ba kawai muna son magancewa ta ɗan lokaci ba ne, to ya kamata mu samo tushen matsalolin, kuma mu kashe su. A bayyane ya ke cewa duniya ta canza sosai saboda ci gaban Dan Adam a fannonin kimiyya da fasaha, kuma matsaloli sun karu sosai sakamakon yawan jama’a da halayyar mutane ta almubazzaranci.
mt: We can start by acknowledging the problem, we can join the effort to improve the environment, and we can become activists to reduce the future difficulty at a certain level. This is like treating a disease in many cases. However, if we just want to treat it temporarily, we should find the root causes, and kill them. It is obvious that the world has changed a lot due to the progress of mankind in science and technology, and the problems have increased greatly due to the increase in population and the wastefulness of people.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Daidaita iko wani tsari ne wanda kasashen Turai suka yi amfani da shi domin tabbatar da ƴancinkan duk ƙasshen yankin Turai. Manufar ita ce cewa duk ƙasashen Turai dole ne su nemi hana wata ƙasa ta zama mai ƙarfi, don haka gwamnatocin ƙasashe sau da yawa sukan canza ƙawancensu don kiyaye daidaito. Yaƙin Gasar Mutanen Espanya ya nuna farkon yaƙin wanda babban batunsa shine daidaiton iko. Mai makin abu ne mai mahimmancin canji, ba za su iya zama da karyar zaman yaki na adini ba. Sabo da haka, yakin shekara talatin zai kasance yaki ne na karshe wanda za a kira yakin adini.
mt: Ƙididdigar iko wani tsari ne wanda kasashen Turai suka yi amfani da shi domin tabbatar da ƴancinkan duk ƙasshen yankin Turai. Manufar ita ce cewa duk ƙasashen Turai dole ne su nemi hana wata ƙasa ta zama mai ƙarfi, don haka gwamnatocin ƙasashe sau da yawa sukan canza ƙawancensu don kiyaye daidaito. Yaƙin Gasar Mutanen Espanya ya nuna farkon yaƙin wanda babban batunsa shine daidaiton iko. Mai makin abu ne mai mahimmancin canji, ba za su iya zama da karyar zaman yaki na adini ba. Sabo da haka, yakin shekara talatin zai kasance yaki ne na karshe wanda za a kira yakin adini.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: A wannan lokaci na tarihin Tarayyan Turai, cocin Katolika, wadda ta yi karfi da arziki, ta fuskanci bincike. Sama da shekara dubu addinin Kirista ya haɗe kasashen Turai waje guda duk da banbance banbance na harsuna da ala’adu. Karfin barnansa ta shafe kowa daga sarki har na gama-gari. Daya daga cikin shishikan addinin krista shine yin amfani da arziki wajen magance matsaloli da kuma yakar talauci sannan kuma jami’in kudi na cocin suna can musamman saboda wannan dalilin. Babban cibiyar shugabancin coci ta kasance a Roma sama da dubban shekaru kuma mayar da arziki da mulki can ya jawo cece-kuce game da ko ana bin wannan shikashikin.
mt: 1,000 years ago, the Catholic Church, which had amassed great wealth, faced scrutiny. Christianity had spread to the rest of Europe despite linguistic and cultural differences. Its power and influence reached everyone from kings to peasants. One of the tenets of Christianity is the use of wealth to alleviate suffering and poverty, and church officials are especially concerned about this because of this reason. The main center of church administration has been in Rome for over 1,000 years and the transfer of wealth and power there has caused controversy about whether this is being followed.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: A firgice Sarki Louis da Sarauniya Marie Antoinette da yayansu guda biyu (Marie yar shekaru 11 da kuma Louis-Charles dan shekara hudu) da kuma yar'uwar Sarki, Madam Elizabeth, wadanda matan kasuwa masu bore a ranar 6 ga watan Oktoba 1789 sun tilasta musu komawa birnin Faris daga garin Versailles. A cikin tarago, suka koma zuwa Paris zagaye da wasu gungun mutane da ke ihu suna kalaman barazanar a kan Sarki da Sarauniya. Abokai masu nisa, ba tare da wayar tarho ba, wayar tauraron dan adam zata iya zama mai zaɓar. A wata lokaci memba na yan zanga-zanga shugaban wata sarauta tsarewa sun kashe wata Versailles a gaban Sarauniya mai firgita.
mt: 6 October 1789, King Louis XVI and Queen Marie Antoinette and their two young children (Marie-Thérèse, age 11, and Louis-Charles, age 4) and the King's sister, Madame Élisabeth, who were being held by market women on 6 October 1789, were forced to return to Paris from Versailles. In the crowd, they were met by a group of people shouting threats against the King and Queen. Distant friends, without warning, a mob could become a lynch mob. At one point, a member of the crowd, a member of the nobility, killed a Versailles in front of the Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Jim kaɗan bayan ɓarkewar tashin hankalin, Birtaniya ta fara toshe mashigan ruwa na Jamus. Dabarun sun yi tasiri, hana shigar da muhimman kayayyakin soja da na farar hulla, ko da yake wannan toshewa ta sabawa dokoki na ƙasa da ƙasa waɗanda yarjejeniyoyin ƙasa da ƙasa da dama na ƙarnoni biyu da suka wuce suka tsara. Birtaniya ta dasa bama bamai a teku domin hana jiragen ruwa shiga wannan yanki na teku, abinda ke da hadari ga jiragen yan baruwanmu. Da shike akwai iyakacin amsa kan wannan dabara, Germany ta yi tsamanin irin wannan amsa ga yakinta na karkashin ruwa mara kima.
mt: Just after the threat of a blockade, Britain began to halt the flow of water from Germany. The plan worked, preventing the entry of important military and civilian vessels, although this blockade broke international laws set by the two previous centuries and beyond. Britain feared the entry of enemy vessels into this area of the sea, and so there was a limit to the response to this blockade, Germany responded in kind to its own undersea blockade.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: A duk faɗin Amurka, akwai kusan rahoto 400,000 na cutar Multiple Sclerosis (MS), abinda ya sa ta zama ja-gaba cikin ciwukan sadarwa a jiki ga matasa da masu shekaru tsaka-tsaki. Cutar MS cuta ce da ke shafar lakkar jikin dan adam, da ya hadar da kwakwalwa da jijiyar lakkar da kuma na kai sakonni. Bincike ya gano cewa mata sun fi alamar samun MS da ninka biyu a kan maza.
mt: 400,000 Americans have Multiple Sclerosis (MS), making it the most common neurological disease in young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that attacks the myelin sheath of the nerves in the brain and spinal cord, as well as the nerve axons themselves. Research has found that women are twice as likely to develop MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Binciken ya gano cewa damuwa, tsoro da bala'i sun daidaita dangantakar da ke tsakanin ciwo da nakasassu a masun fama da ciwon baya. Sakamakon bala'i ne kawai, ba shiga damuwa da tsoro ba ya kasance sharaɗin ganawar sati-sati karkashin tsarin PA. Wadanda suka sunduma cikin ayuka na yau da kullum na bukatar taimako wajen sauya mummunar tunani na zafi tare da bambanta tsakanin tsananin radadi da rashin sukuni da juyawar gabobi ke haifarwa.
mt: The study found that anxiety, fear and panic were associated with the relationship between illness and disability. The consequences of panic are only the symptoms of the constant state of anxiety under the PA system. Those who suffer from daily panic attacks want help in changing the negative thinking with the difference between high rates and low self-esteem and the rotation of the head.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Wasan takobi na zamani ya na da matakai daban daban, kama daga dalibai masu koyo a jami’a zuwa ga kwararru da kuma na gasar olympic. Ana buga wasan yawanci a wani tsarin gwagwarmaya, wani mai wasan takobi yana gogawa da wani.
mt: The modern sport of auto racing has many forms, from student racers at universities to professional racers and even Olympic racers. The sport is usually contested in a format of competition, where one racer attempts to overtake another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Harbuwa da guba a cikin jiki ba abu ne da ake iya ganewa da wuri ba. Alamu irinsu amai gama gari ne don haka ba a iya tantancewa da wurwuri. Hanya mafi saukin gane ko ana sami guba a ciki, shine watakila idan an sami budadden kwano na magani ko wasu sinadarai masu guba da ake amfanin yau da gobe da su a gida. Duba bayanin da ke jiki domin samun bayanai na taimakon gaggawa agame da gubar.
mt: 1. Bruising and swelling in the body are not visible and cannot be located. The most reliable way to detect or locate bruising or swelling is probably if you have a sudden increase in your blood pressure or other toxic substances that are normally present in your body. See the information below for help with bruising or swelling.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Kafin a Duba wanda aka mishi laifi, dole ne ka farko bincike wurin don tabbatar da tsaronka. Kuna buƙatar lura da matsayin wanda aka azabtar yayin da kuka kusanci shi ko ita da kowane tutocin wuta ta atomatik. Idan kun ji rauni yayin ƙoƙarin taimako, kawai kuna iya sa al'amura su kara taɓarɓarewa.
mt: Before you can be convicted of a crime, you must first be proven innocent. You must be aware of the state of the person or persons you are attempting to aid, or you may make matters worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Akwai tasiri na zamantakewa da siyasa masu yawa kamar amfani da tsarin awo cikakke, barin kama-karya zuwa jamhuriyya, kishin ƙasa tare da imanin cewa ƙasar ta mutanen ƙasa ce ba mutum ɗaya mai mulki ba. Hakanan bayan juyin halin an bude ayyuka ga duk maza masu neman aiki inda hakan ya bada dama ga masu buri da kokari su sami cigaba. Hakanan ya kasance ga sojoji saboda maimakon martaba sojoji ya kasance bisa la'akari da aji sai yanzu suka dogara da cailaber. Juyin Juya Hali na Faransa ya kuma ba sauran wasu mutane masu tsananin karfi na wata ƙasa damar fara nasu juyin juya halin.
mt: There were many social and political consequences such as the complete abolition of slavery, leaving room for innovation to a republic, giving jobs to all men seeking work where this gave opportunity to the ambitious and the industrious to advance. It also benefited the military as instead of a draft the military now relies on volunteers. The French Revolution also gave other countries the opportunity to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Kowa yana shiga cikin jama'a kuma yana amfani da tsarin sufuri. Kusan kowa yana korafi game da tsarin sufuri. A kasashen da suka ci gaba ba kasafai ake jin irin wannan korafin ba game da ingancin ruwa ko gadoji da ke faduwa. Me yasa tsarukan sufuri su ke haifar da irin waɗannan ƙorafi, me ya sa suke faɗuwa a kullum? Shin injiniyoyin sufuri ne kawai ba ƙwararru ba? Ko akwai wani mahimmin abu di ke faruwa ne?
mt: Everyone is part of the public and uses the transportation system. Almost everyone is aware of the quality of the water or the potholes that are appearing. Why do transportation systems cause these potholes to appear? Are transportation engineers not experts? Or is there something more important going on?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Gudanar Zirga-zirga shine nazari kan zirga-zirgar ɗaiɗaikun direbobi da ababen hawa tsakanin wurare biyu tare da ma’amala da suke yi da juna. Abin takaici, bincikawar zirga-zirga ababen hawa abu ne mai wahala saboda ba’a iya yin hasashen hakikanci halin direba dari bisa dari. An yi sa'a, direbobi su na tuki a cikin nutsuwa yadda kwararar ababen hawa a titi ke tafiya a natse don haka ana iya nazarin yanayin ta hanyar lissafi. Domin gabatar da yanayin hanya, an kulla alaƙa tsakanin muhimman al’amura uku: (1) gudana, (2) cinkoso da (3) watsuwa. Wadannan dangantaka suna taimakawa wajen tsari, zayyana, da kuma gudanar da kayayyakin babbar hanya.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the movement of traffic along roads and highways.  Traffic flow is a complex phenomenon that is difficult to predict accurately.  Traffic flow is affected by many factors, including the number of vehicles on the road, the speed of the vehicles, and the distance between vehicles. ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Gwajin Hershey da Chase na ɗaya daga cikin ra’ayoyin da ke kan gaba da ke nuni da cewa DNA wani abu ne na rayuwa. Hershey da Chase sun yi amfani da phages, ko ƙwayoyin cututtuka, wajen shigar da sinadarin DNA nasu a cikin wata ƙwayar cuta. Sunyi gwaje-gwaje guda biyu wanda ke nuna alamar ko DNA a cikin fage tare da phosphorus na rediyoaktif ko furotin na phage tare da sulfur na rediyo.
mt: The Hershey and Chase experiments were among the first to demonstrate that DNA was a constituent of life. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to introduce DNA into a host bacterium. They performed two experiments that showed the presence of DNA in phage with phosphorus radioisotope or phage with sulfur radioisotope.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Maye gurbi zai iya samun bambancin nau'ikan sakamako iri daban-daban dangane da nau'in maye gurbi, mahimmancin yanki na kayan gado ya shafa kuma ko kwayoyin halita da abin ya shafa sune kwayoyin halita. Rikiɗa a ƙwayoyin halitta na layin ƙwayar cuta ne kaɗai za a iya gadar wa yara, yayin da rikiɗa a wani wuri kan iya haddasa mutuwar ƙwayar halitta ko cutar sankara.
mt: Different types of transplants may have different outcomes depending on the type of transplant, the importance of the graft site, and whether the graft is a living cell or a dead cell. Grafts to the blood line are the only ones that can be transplanted to children, while grafts to other sites may cause death of the graft or disease.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

Rikiɗa a ƙwayoyin halitta na layin ƙwayar cuta ne kaɗai za a iya gadar wa yara, yayin da rikiɗa a wani wuri kan iya haddasa mutuwar ƙwayar halitta ko cutar sankara.
mt: Different types of transplants may have different outcomes depending on the type of transplant, the importance of the graft site, and whether the graft is a living cell or a dead cell. Grafts to the blood line are the only ones that can be transplanted to children, while grafts to other sites may cause death of the graft or disease.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Ana ganin akuya ta kasance gida ta farko kusan shekaru 10,000 da suka gabata a tsaunukan Zagros na Iran. Al’adu da ƙabilun zamanin da ne su ka fara adana su domin sauƙin samun madara, gashi, nama, da kuma fatu. A koyaushe ana ajiye awakin gida a cikin garken shanun da ke yawo a kan tsaunuka ko wasu wuraren kiwo, galibi masu kiwon awaki waɗanda yara da samari ne ke kula da su, kwatankwacin sanannen makiyayi. Wadannan hanyoyin kiwo har yanzu ana amfani dasu.
mt: Ƙarfin gida, wanda aka sani da ƙarfin gida, ya kasance gida na farko kusan shekaru 10,000 da suka gabata a tsaunukan Zagros na Iran. Al'adu da ƙabilun zamanin da ne su ka fara adana su domin sauƙin samun madara, gashi, nama, da kuma fatu. A koyaushe ana ajiye awakin gida a cikin garken shanun da ke yawo a kan tsaunuka ko wasu wuraren kiwo, galibi masu kiwon awaki waɗanda yara da samari ne ke kula da su, kwatankwacin sanannen makiyayi. Wadannan hanyoyin kiwo har yanzu ana amfani dasu.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf wani wasa ne da ƴan wasan ke amfani da sanduna domin buga ƙwallaye zuwa cikin ramuka. An buga ramuka goma sha takwas yayin zagaye na yau da kullun, tare da yan wasa galibi suna farawa akan rami na farko akan kwas ɗin kuma suna gamawa a ranar goma sha takwas. Ɗan wasan da ya ɗauki ƙarancin bugu, ko kuma jefin kulkin, don kammala sashen yake samu nasara. Akan buga wasan ne a kan ciyawa, inda a ke sassabe ciyawar da ke zagayen ramin wanda a ke kira kore.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use sand wedges to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played in a round, with players typically starting on the first hole and playing in order to the eighteenth. The player who completes the course in the fewest strokes is the winner. The course is played over a series of tees, with each hole having a designated tee.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Babbar manufar kimiyya ita ce gano yadda duniya ke wanzuwa ta hanyar kimiyya. Alal hakika wannan hanya ta bincike ita ce ke yin jagora ga mafi yawan bincike na kimiyya. Ba shi kaɗai bane dai, yin gwaji, kuma gwaji wata hanya ce ta jarrabawa da ake amfani da ita domin kawar da ɗaya ko fiye daga cikin harsashe da za a samu. yin tambayoyi, da fadin ra’ayi su ma suna yin jagora ga binciken kimiyya.
mt: The main purpose of science is to understand how the world works through science. Indeed, this is the way most scientific research is done. Not only that, but testing, and testing is a way of verifying or disproving one or more of the hypotheses that can be found. Asking questions, and the scope of view also guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Mahaukaciyar guguwa ta afkawa wani ƙaramin yanki idan aka kwatanta da sauran guguwa masu ƙarfi, amma suna iya lalata komai a hanyar su. Guguwa kan tuge bishiyoyin, su yage falankai daga jikin gine-gine, sannan su yi wurgi da motoci zuwa sama. Kashi biyu na guguwa masu tsananin ƙarfi kan wuce tsawon awanni uku. Wadannan mugayen guguwar suna ɗauke da iska har zuwa 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: The gusts were strong enough to blow over a small area compared to other gusts, but they can knock down trees, shatter building windows, and blow cars off the road. The strongest gusts last for about three seconds. These gusts can carry air up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: ‘yan Adam sun kasance suna kerawa da amfani da tabarau mai nuna girman abu shekaru dubbai da suka wuce. Duk da haka, an yi ainihin na'urar hangen nesa na fari a Turai a karshen karni na 16. Na’urar hangen nesa tayi amfani da gilashi biyu domin sanya abubuwa dake nesa su dawo kusa kuma babba.
mt: People have been using mirrors to reflect objects far away for centuries. However, the first true telescope was invented in Europe at the end of the 16th century. The telescope used two lenses to bring distant objects close and large.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhammadu yana matukar sha'awar al'amuran da suka wuce rayuwar wannan duniya. Ya na yawan ziyarar kogon da a ka fi sani da na “Hira” a tsaunin “Noor” (wato haske) domin kadaicewa yayi tunani. ya ɓoye kansa, wanda ya rayu a lokacin, yana ba da hoton karkatawar ruhaniyar Muhammad a tsarari. Kasancewa a saman ɗayan duwatsun arewacin Makka, kogon ya zama ya keɓe daga sauran duniya. A hakika akwai matukar wahalar gano wajen ko ma ka idan ka san ya kasance. Kana shiga cikin kogon zaka ji kadaita ta kama ka. Babu abin da za a iya gani face kyakkyawan sararin samaniya da tsaunuka masu yawa da ke kewayen. Baka iya ji ko ganin wadannan daga cikin kogon.
mt: Muhammad is very interested in events beyond this world. He has spent many hours in the cave known as "Hira" on the mountain of "Noor" (light) to meditate. He has secluded himself, where he lived during this time, giving a picture of the revelation of Muhammad in the desert. Being on the top of one of the mountains of the north of Mecca, the cave became isolated from the rest of the world. Indeed, there is great difficulty in finding out whether or not you are there. Entering the cave you will see the beautiful landscape of the desert with many mountains surrounding it. You cannot see or hear these things from the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: An samar da layukan tarago a Ingila tun a wajejen Ƙarni na 16. Duk da cewa keken dokin sun kunshi katako a jere, amma su kan ba da dama ga dawakan da ke jan su yin sauri tare da jan manyan kaya fiye da a kan hanyoyi masu gargada na zamanin. An sanya Crossties tun da wuri don su tsayar layukan. Sai dai, hankali, an gano cewa layukan za su fi dacewa idan suna da ɗori na ƙarfe a saman su. Wannan ya zama aikin gama gari, sai ƙarfe ya haifar da ƙarin lalacewa a ƙafafun katako na kekunan. Daga karshe, an sauya tayoyin katako da na karfe. A cikin 1767 an kaddamar da farkon hanyar jirgin kasa kerar karfe.
mt: Ƙarfe na layukan tarago a Ingila tun a wajejen Ƙarni na 16. Duk da cewa keken dokin sun kunshi katako a jere, amma su kan ba da dama ga dawakan da ke jan su yin sauri tare da jan manyan kaya fiye da a kan hanyoyi masu gargada na zamanin. An sanya Crossties tun da wuri don su tsayar layukan. Sai dai, hankali, an gano cewa layukan za su fi dacewa idan suna da ɗori na ƙarfe a saman su. Wannan ya zama aikin gama gari, sai ƙarfe ya haifar da ƙarin lalacewa a ƙafafun katako na kekunan. Daga karshe, an sauya tayoyin katako da na karfe. A cikin 1767 an kaddamar da farkon hanyar jirgin kasa kerar karfe.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: Tsarin fasaha da adabi samar da al’adu, wanda marubuta irinsu Gothe, Fichte da Schlegel su ka samar. A cikin siyakin romanci, yanayin kasa ya canza mutane, kuma lokaci da yawa sai al'adu da al'adu masu alaƙa da wannan yanayin suka taso, kuma waɗannan, kasancewar suna jituwa da matsayin jama'a, sun fi ƙa'idodi da aka kafa bisa doka da oda.
mt: 19th century German Romanticism, pioneered by writers such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. In the course of the novel, the state of nature changes people, and over time, related cultures emerge, and these, as they are born into the state of society, are more governed by custom and tradition than by law and order.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: Wanzuwar Fasahar Ƙere-ƙere al’amari ne da ya haɗo wani faffaɗan fage na ra’ayoyi a aikace, daga bunƙasar fasaha ko muhimmancin fasahar ƙere-ƙere zuwa ga haƙiƙanin sanin cewa makomar dan adam tana tafiya ne bisa tabbatacciyar hikima wadda ke da alaƙa da dokokin kimiyya da kuma bayyanar su a cikin fasahar ƙere-ƙere. Yawancin fassarar tabbatuwar fasahar zamani sun kunshi ra’ayi mafiya yaduwa guda biyu: cewa na fasaha ita kanta na bin tafarki wacce ta sha bamban da tasirin al’ada ko siyasa da kuma cewa fasaha nada “tasiri” ga al’umma masu asali, fiye da na tsarin yanayin zamantakewa. Misali, mutum na iya cewa motar tilas ba zata haifar da ci gaban hanyoyi ba. Koyaya, hanyar sadarwa ta ƙasa gabaɗaya ba ta da tasirin tattalin arziƙi don ƙarancin motoci, saboda haka ana ƙirƙirar sabbin hanyoyin samarwa don rage farashin mallakar mota. Hakanan mallakar motoci da yawa yana haifar da yawan hadari a kan hanyoyi, wanda ke haifar da kirkirar sabbin dabaru a fannin kiwon lafiya don gyaran jikin da ya lalace.
mt: The development of technology is an event that has brought about a shift in attitudes in the public sphere, from a breakthrough in science or technology to the importance of technology in society and the recognition of its impact on society. For example, a person may say that a car will not bring about progress in roads. However, the overall impact of road transport on the economy does not justify the development of new methods of production to reduce the cost of car ownership. Also, the ownership of many cars leads to an increase in accidents on roads, which leads to the creation of new methods in the field of medicine to treat damaged bodies.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: Alamar “kwarin sama” ta yi kama da V sannan “alamar kwarin ƙasa” kamar maɗauri ne ko murabba’i da ya kuskure gefen ƙasan ta. Sama yana nufin ya kamata ka fara daga sama ka tura bakan, sannan kasan yana nufin ka fara daga kwado (wanda shine inda hannunka ke rike da baka) ka ja bakan. Yawancin lokoci up-bow na fitar da murya mai laushi, haka kuma down-bow na da karfi da tabatarwa sosai. Ka saki jikinka wajen bada naka makin, amma kar ka manta makin da aka buga su na da dalilai na kida, don haka ya kamata a girmama su.
mt: The up-bow is a symbol of the bow being drawn from above, and the down-bow is a symbol of the bow being drawn from below. Most up-bows are light and expressive, and most down-bows are strong and conclusive. Keep your bow arm relaxed, but be aware that the bow you are holding has a reason for its shape, so it should be respected.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Ba kamar sauran birrai ba, hominids baya amfani da hannayensu a cikin motsi ko ɗaukar nauyi ko jujjuyawa ta cikin bishiyoyi. Hannun chimpanzee da ƙafa sun yi daidai da girma da tsayi, suna nuna amfanin hannun don ɗaukar nauyi a cikin yatsan ƙafa. Hannun dan adam ya fi kafa gajarta, da kasusuwa miƙaƙƙu. Busassun kasussuwan hannu wanda ke da shekaru miliyan biyu zuwa miliyan uku sun nunna wannan matsawa a kwarewa na hannun daga tafiya zuwa tasiri kan sarrafawa.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids did not use their hands in locomotion or carrying weight or climbing in trees. The chimpanzee hand and forearm are similar in size and length, showing the use of the hand for carrying weight in the forearm. The human hand has more knuckle joints. The knuckle joints that have been around for two to three million years show the transition of the hand from movement to manipulation of objects.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
