src: Binciken ƙarni na ashirin ya nuna cewa akwai rabe-raben halittar gado guda biyu: ɓoyayye da na bayyananne. Maye gurbi yana ƙara sabon bambancin kwayoyin, kuma zaɓi ya cire shi daga tafkin bambancin da aka bayyana. Rabuwa da sake haduwa iri dabam-dabam baya da gaba tsakanin gidan ruwan guda biyu a kowace karni.
mt: 100,000-year-old analysis shows there are two distinct populations of Neanderthals: one with dark skin and one with light skin. The choice removes it from the pool of variation that has been described. Repeated mixing and matching between the two populations occurred over and over again in each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Binciken ƙarni na ashirin ya nuna cewa akwai rabe-raben halittar gado guda biyu: ɓoyayye da na bayyananne. Maye gurbi yana ƙara sabon bambancin kwayoyin, kuma zaɓi ya cire shi daga tafkin bambancin da aka bayyana. Rabuwa da sake haduwa iri dabam-dabam baya da gaba tsakanin gidan ruwan guda biyu a kowace karni.
mt: 100,000-year-old analysis shows there are two distinct populations of Neanderthals: one with dark skin and one with light skin. The choice removes it from the pool of variation that has been described. Repeated mixing and matching between the two populations occurred over and over again in each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: A can cikin yankin savanna, yana da wahala ga wata halitta dangin biri da ke da tsarin narkewar abinci irin na mutum ta iya gamsar da buƙatunta na sinadarin amino daga albarkatun tsirrai da ake da su. Bugu da ƙari, ƙin yin hakan yana tattare da munanan sakamako:kamar rashin yin girma, rashin abinci mai gina jiki, da kuma a karshe mutuwa. Ma’dinan tsirrai da aka fi saurin amfani da su sun kasance sunadaran gina jiki da za'a iya samu a ganye da ƙwaya, amma waɗannan suna da tauri ga halittu irin mu wajen narkewa har sai an dafa su. Sabanin haka, abincin dabbobi (tururuwa, gara, ƙwai) ba kawai ana iya narkewa cikin sauƙi ba, amma suna samar da sunadarai masu yawa waɗanda ke ɗauke da dukkan muhimman amino acid. In an yi la’akari da dukkan abubuwa, bai kamata mu yi mamaki ba idan magabatanmu suka magance “matsalar kayan gina jiki” ta irin hanyar da goggon biri a yankin savanna suke yi a yau.
mt: In the savanna, it is difficult for an animal with a human-like diet to meet its amino acid requirements from the available plant resources. In addition, not doing so has many consequences: stunted growth, poor tissue development, and ultimately death. The most commonly used plant resources are rich in tissue-building amino acids, but are difficult to digest until cooked. In contrast, animal foods (grasses, shrubs, and trees) can be easily digested, and provide many amino acids, including all the essential ones. Taking all this into account, it is not surprising that our ancestors solved the "tissue-building problem" in the way that savanna antelopes do today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Rassan al’adu suna sada mutane masu tunani iri daya da suke ji tsarin rayuwa na al’umma bai dace da su ba inda suke ba su damar ganin suna da muhimanci a al’umma. Ana iya bambanta kananan al’adu saboda shekara, bangarenci na jama’a, matsayi cikin al’umma, guri, da/ko kuma jintsin membobi. Kyawawan siffofin da suke tabbatar da wata ƙaramar al’ada a matsayin wadda ta fita daban kan iya kasancewa na yare, kyau, addini, siyasa, jinsi, na yanki, ko hadin abubuwa. Membobin masana'antar sau da yawa suna nuna alamar kasancewa memba ta hanyar rarrabe mai amfani da alama ta salon, wanda ya haɗa da salon, halayen kirki, da ɗaukar hoto.
mt: 1. Ethnic groups are often distinguished by their ability to think in terms of a social order that does not fit them. They can be distinguished by age, membership in a group, social status, residence, or also by a combination of these. Members of an industry often show membership by means of a symbol, which includes style, mannerisms, and taking pictures.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Yara suna ɗaukar fahimta ta launin fata da tsana ta launin fata tun suna ƙanana kuma waɗannan tsana ta launin fata kan shafi halayya. Alal misali, yaran da suke daga tsirarun kabilun da ake yi wa kallon basa wani abin kirki a makaranta akwai yiwuwar hakan ya dakushe himmarsu a makaranta da zarar sun fahimci cewa ana musu wani kallon-kallo saboda launin fatarsu.
mt: Children are aware of the concept of race and skin color from a young age and these concepts can affect their behavior. For example, children from minority groups who are made aware of a difference in their appearance at school may be more likely to be bullied at school once they are aware of the difference.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: Daya daga cikin matakan da ake amfani dashi domin nuna muhimmacin zamantakewa shine nuna kadan daga cikin hali na takaici wanda yara suka fuskanta, ta hanyar sakaci, masifa, ko cin zarafi, kuma basu zamantakewa da manya ba yayin da suke girma. Ana kiran irin waɗannan yaran “sakakku” ko masu wuyar juyawa. Mutane sun sha kulle waɗansu sakakkun yara (yawanci iyayensu ne); a wasu al’amuran kuma barin yaran na da alaƙa da ƙin amincewar iyaye da naƙasar basira ko ta jikin yaro. Yaran mara zuciya masu jin tsoro na iya fuskantar mummunan cin zarafin yara ko rauni kafin a watsar da su ko su gudu. Wasu ana zargin dabbobi ne suka yi rainon su; an ce wasu sun yi rayuwa a daji da kansu. Lokacin da ba dabba ba ta dabbaro gabaɗaya, yaro mai ɗaukar hoto yana nuna halayensa (a cikin iyakokin zahiri) kusan gaba daya kamar na kulawar-dabbobi, kamar tsoron sa ko rashin kulawa ga mutane.
mt: One of the criteria for determining the significance of an event is the number of people affected by it, particularly children; in some cases, entire populations. Children are particularly vulnerable to trauma, abuse, or neglect, and may suffer serious injury before being removed or running away. Some are alleged to have been abducted by animals; others are said to have lived wild in the woods with them. When no animal is involved, the child in a photograph typically displays (within the bounds of reality) his or her emotions (fear or neglect) almost exactly like that of a wild animal, such as a deer or a bear.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Noma domin abinci shine tsarin noma wanda ake yinsa domin kawai a samar da abincin da zai wadatar da mutum da iyalansa. Noma domin abinci kawai abu ne mai sauki, sau da yawa, ana amfani da iri na shuka wanda ya dace da kasar noman wajen, tare da sauya abin shuka duk shekara a gona guda, domin samun cikakkiyar yabanya. A tarihance mafi yawan manoma sun kasance suna aikin noma kuma wannan har yanzu haka lamarin yake a yawancin ƙasashe masu tasowa.
mt: Subsistence farming is a system of farming where the primary objective is to produce enough food to feed a family or community. Subsistence farming is a safe, sustainable, and often preferred method of farming, as it uses local crops that are well-suited to the local climate and soil, and the farmer can change the crop each year to ensure maximum yield. In the past, most farmers were subsistence farmers, and this is still true in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Watakila yawon bude ido da aka fi sani shi ne wanda mutane ke alakantawa da tafiya: Yawon bude ido don nishaɗi. Yanzu ne lokacin da mutane ke zuwa wani waje daban da irin wanda su ka saba yau da gobe domin hutawa da annashuwa. Bakin tekuna, filin shakatawa da zangon hutawa su ne mafi wuraren da baki masu yawon bude ido ke fi zuwa. Idan makasudin ziyarar mutum zuwa wani wuri shi ne sanin tarihinta da al'adunta to wannan nau'in yawon shakatawa an san shi da yawon bude ido game da al'adu. Masu yawon bude ido na iya ziyartan alamar kasa dabam-dabam na wata kasa ko kuma suna iya mai da hankali waje daya.
mt: Perhaps the most well-known type of tourism is recreational tourism. Now is the time when people go to a different place than they usually do at night to relax and unwind. The beach, amusement park and spa are the most popular places tourists visit. If a person's purpose in visiting a place is to learn about its history and culture, this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists can visit a country's national symbol at once or they can focus on one place.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Mutune da suka kasance a lamarin cikin gomman shekaru sun taimake mu wajen fahimtar karfinmu da kuma jarabarmu yayin da kuma muke la’akari da wahalhalun da ke ciki har ma da matsalolin ciki. Yayin sauraren kowa da kowa yana bayar da labaran kansa ko na iyali da kuma na wuraren aiki/kungiya, muna samun muhimman bayanai da suka gabata na mutanen da suka yi tasiri ta hanya mai kyau ko akasin haka game da tsari ko dabi’un kungiya/wurin aiki. Yayin fahimtar tarihin wani ba a daukar fahimtar aladun, ya kan taimakawa mutane wajan gane a gurbin da suke a tarihin maaikatar. Yayin auna cigaban da aka samu tare da fahimtar gazawa, ɗaiɗaikun mutane tare da duk waɗanda suke cikin shirin sun ƙara gano darajoji, manufa, da kuma al’amuran da ke tafiyar da ma’aikatar. A wannan misalin, tuna wasu misalan da suka gabata na halayyar kirkire-kirkire da kuma nasarar da suka haifar ya taimakawa mutane wajen fahimtar sabbin sauye-sauyen da kuma alkiblar cocin wurin. Wadannan labaran nasarorin sun sassauta girman fargabar sauyin, yayin da yake saka tunanin sauyin da za a iya samu a gaba.
mt: 1. We are aware of the impact of our actions and the effect they have on our colleagues and the wider community. We are aware of the impact
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

We are aware of the impact of our actions and the effect they have on our colleagues and the wider community. As we continue to share our own or our family’s news or workplace/department news, we are receiving important information and updates from people who have been affected by the incident or the way it was handled. We are aware of the impact
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Mahangar zamanin ga koyo yana ba da 'yanci daga kafaffun ƙa’idoji. Babu wata hanya mai kyau don koyo. A takaice dai, babu wani abun da za a koya. Koyarwa tana faruwa ne a tsakanin mai koyo da kuma karantarwar da ake yi. Abin da muke fuskanta a yanzu da duk wani yi-da-kanka da gabatar da bayani, shirye-shiryen talabijin na koyo ya nuna haka. Da yawa daga cikinmu sun sami kanmu muna kallon wani talibijin da ke ba mu labarin wani tsari ko ƙwarewa wanda ba za mu taɓa shiga ko amfani da wannan ilimin ba. Ba za mu taɓa yi wa mota garambawul ba, gina maɓuɓɓugar ruwa a ciki filin bayan gidan mu, mu yi tafiya zuwa Peru don nazarin gidajen mutanen dā, ko kuma yi wa gidan maƙwabtcin mu kwaskwarima.
mt: 1. The age of instruction is free from prejudice. There is no right way to learn. Indeed, there is no learning to be done. Instruction occurs between the instructor and the learner. What we are confronted with now, and many of us have experienced, is watching a television show that tells us about a technique or skill that we will never use or apply. We will never drive a car, build a swimming pool in our backyard, travel to Peru to study the houses of the poor, or give our neighbor a computer.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Katse bacci yanayi ne na farkawa da gangan cikin lokacin yin bacci na al’ada da kuma komawa bacci cikin dan kaknkanin lokaci daga baya (minti 10-60). Ana iya yin hakan a sauƙaƙe ta amfani da agogon ƙararrawa wanda ba shi da nutsuwa don kawo ku cikin sani ba tare da an tashe ku ba. Idan ka sami kanka ka sake saita agogo a cikin barcinka, ana iya sanya shi a ɗaya gefen ɗakin, yana tilasta ka tashi daga kan gado don kashe shi. Sauran zabukan da suka danganta da lissafin ɗabi’ar rayuwa sun kunshi shan kayan ruwa da yawa (musamman ruwa ko shayi, sanannen sinadari mai jawo fitsari) kafin barci, da ke tilastawa mutum ya tashi ya yi ftisari.
mt: 1. A sudden awakening from a normal sleep and a return to sleep within a few minutes (10-60). This can be done quickly by using a loud alarm clock that does not require you to get out of bed to turn it off. If you wake up in the middle of the night, you can set the alarm on one side of the bed, forcing you to get up to turn it off. Other recommendations that are associated with the sleep hygiene include drinking a lot of water (especially water or tea, known to cause gas) before sleep, and requiring the person to get up to use the bathroom.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Wasu mutane sun gaskata cewa fuskantar mafarkai da ba na hakika ba yawancin lokuta na iya jawo gajiya sosai. Babban dalilin don wannan lamarin shi ne sakamakon mafarkai da ake iya ganewa da yake faɗaɗa tsawon lokacin tsakanin yanayoyin barcin REM. Karancin jujuyawar kwayar ido cikin barci (REMs) yanayin da kake samun bacci na hakika don baiwa jiki damar murmurewa, idan ya ta’azzara zai iya haifar da matsala. Wannan yana da gajiyarwa kamar kuna tashi kowane minti ashirin ko talatin ku kalli Talabijin. Tasirin ya dogara ne akan yadda sau da yawa kwakwalwarka take ƙoƙarin yin mafarki mai kyau kowane dare.
mt: Some people have reported experiencing vivid dreams most nights. The main reason for this is the presence of REM sleep periods. A lack of REM sleep cycles is what causes the brain to be deprived of the opportunity to process and consolidate memories, if it is aroused it may lead to problems. This is roughly equivalent to waking up every 20 or 30 minutes to turn on the TV. The effect depends on how often your brain tries to make good dreams every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Tawagogin da bana ainihi ba ana ganinsu daidai da yadda tawagogi na gaske suke, amma dai akwai wasu ‘yan banbance-banbancen da ba za a rasa ba. Mambobin na kan intanet galibi suna aiki a matsayin hanyar tuntuɓa ta rukuninsu na zahiri. Yawancin lokaci suna da 'yancin kai fiye da membobin ƙungiyar al'ada kamar yadda kungiyoyin su zasu iya haduwa bisa tsarin lokaci daban-daban wanda mai kula da su na iya fahimtar da su. Kasancewar ainihin “tawagar da ba a iya gani” (Larson da LaFasto, a sheakarar 1989, shafi na 109) shi ma wani nau’i ne na wata tawaga ba ta zahiri ba. “Tawagar da ba a gani” ita ce tawagar gudanarwa wadda kowanne memba ya ke biyayya. Tawagar da ba a gani tana sanya ƙa'idodi ga kowanne memba.
mt: Ƙungiyoyin da ba a iya gani ba galibi suna aiki a matsayin hanyar tuntuɓa ta rukuninsu na zahiri. Yawancin lokaci suna da 'yancin kai fiye da membobin ƙungiyar al'ada kamar yadda kungiyoyin su zasu iya haduwa bisa tsarin lokaci daban-daban wanda mai kula da su na iya fahimtar da su. Kasancewar ainihin “tawagar da ba a iya gani” (Larson da LaFasto, a sheakarar 1989, shafi na 109) shi ma wani nau’i ne na wata tawaga ba ta zahiri ba. “Tawagar da ba a gani” ita ce tawagar gudanarwa wadda kowanne memba ya ke biyayya. Tawagar da ba a gani tana sanya ƙa'idodi ga kowanne memba.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Tsarin tallan ya dogara wajen gano abinda ya fi ba mutane sha’awa ko su ka fi so. Waɗannan hasashe suna nuna cewa mutane suna da wasu buƙatu da/ko sha'awa waɗanda akai maida su ciki yayin da suke manyanta zuwa balaga. Wadannan ra'ayoyin suna kallon menene game da wasu mutane da ke sa su abubuwan da suke yi da kuma wanne abubuwan ne a muhallin su zai sanya su yi ko kuma kin yin nau’in wasu abu. A matakan bayanan tsarin abubuwa, guda biyu mafi shahara su ne Hierachy of Needs na Maslow Two factor theory na Hertzberg.
mt: The model is based on identifying what people want or desire. These statements indicate that people have some needs and/or desires that they want to fulfill while they are thinking about going on a trip. These views look at what other people do and what the environment will do to them or not to do something. At the level of the structure of events, the two most popular are Maslow's hierarchy of needs Two factor theory of Hertzberg.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Dokar na uku ɗin da aka fi saɓa ko wulaƙantar da ita wani ja-gora mai sauƙi ne da yake ƙirƙira canji yayin riƙewa wani aunin tsari a cikin wani hoto. Ya bayyana cewa wuri mafi mahimmanci a darasin shine mahadar layuka wanda ya raba hoton a tsaye da kuma a kwance (duba misali).
mt: 3 of the most common or misused rules of thumb are easy to create a change in an aspect of an image while cropping. It shows that the most important part of the aspect ratio is the ratio of the image to the crop (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: A misali, nau’in hoto marar motsi da aka fi sani a duniya shi ne 35mm, wanda shi ne girman fim na hoto da aka fi amfani da shi a ƙarshen zamanin fim ɗin hannu. Har yau din nan ana sarrafa shi, amma muhimmin abu a nan kyamarar komi da ruwanka ce ta gaje shi da ke sunsuno hotuna. Abin mamaki shine zubin 35mm a haƙiƙa fadin 36mm ya ke da shi da kuma tsawon 24mm. A lissafin wannan tsarin (idan aka raba sha biyu domin samun adadi mafi karancin lamba) zai kasance a daidaiton 3:2. Yawancin hanyoyin gama gari na yau da kullun (misali tsarin APS na iyali) ya kusa da wannan tsari.
mt: 35mm is the most common film size in the world, and is the standard size of film used in the late 20th century. It is still used, but is being replaced by the smaller 24mm wide and 36mm high format. The aspect ratio of this format (if you divide the width by the height) is 3:2. Most modern formats (such as APS) are close to this.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Rashin alfanu na gilasan kusantowa shine cewa wahalar tsayar da gani da kuma yawan kayan gilashin da ake bukata domin cim ma wasu jerin nisan gani ya fi girma akan gilasan ƙayyadajjen gani. Wannan na kasancewa ba matsala ba saboda masu ƙirar madubin sun cimma wani matsayi babba a wajen ƙera madubi. Wannan ya bai wa tabarau mai kara girma dama wajen samar da ingantattun hotuna fiye da na tabarau mai takaitaccen tsawo. Nakasun gilashin daukan hoto mai kusanto da hoto shine girman fadin kofar da haske ke shiga (saurinta) mai rauni ne. Wannan yana sanya ruwan tabarau masu hangyen nesa mara tsada mai amfani a cikin yanayin ƙananan haske ba tare da walƙiya ba.
mt: Ƙirar gilashin da ake bukata don cim ma wasu jerin nisan gani ya fi girma akan gilasan ƙayyadajjen gani. Wannan na kasancewa ba matsala ba saboda masu ƙirar madubin sun cimma wani matsayi babba a wajen ƙera madubi. Nakasun gilashin daukan hoto mai kusanto da hoto shine girman fadin kofar da haske ke shiga (saurinta) mai rauni ne. Wannan yana sanya ruwan tabarau masu hangyen nesa mara tsada mai amfani a cikin yanayin ƙananan haske ba tare da walƙiya ba.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Sufanci shine bin tarayya da, alaka tare da, ko sane da ainihin gaskiyar, allahntakar, gaskiyar ruhaniya, ko Allah. Mai imani yana neman wata ƙwarewa, ilhama, ko basira kai tsaye a cikin tabbacin allahntaka/allah ko alloli. Mabiya suna bin wasu hanyoyi na rayuwa, ko ayyukan da aka yi niyyar haɓaka waɗancan abubuwan. ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Sufanci shine bin tarayya da, alaka tare da, ko sane da ainihin gaskiyar, allahntakar, gaskiyar ruhaniya, ko Allah. src: A tsawon lokaci a karnoni na goma sha tara da ashirin, an yi imanin cewa mazaunan farko na New Zealand su ne mutanen Maori, waɗanda suka yi farautar manya-manyan tsuntsaye da ake kira moas. Daga nan ƙa’idar ta tabbatar da ra’ayin cewa mutanen Maori sun yi kaura daga Polynesia a wata Babbar Kwambar Jiragen ruwa sannan suka karbe New Zealand daga Moriori, inda suka kafa al’ummar manoma. Koyaya, sabbin shaidu sun nuna cewa Moriori wasu kungiya ce ta birnin Maori ne wanda suka yi hijira daga New Zealand zuwa Tsibirin Chatham, suna haɓaka al'adunsu na musamman, na zaman lafiya. Akwai wani kabila a tsibirir Chatham sune yan Maori wadanda suka yi hijira daga New Zealand. Suna kiran kansu da suna Moriori akwai wasu rikita-rikita a karshen lamarin, an shafe Moriori.
mt: 16,000 years ago, it was believed that the first New Zealanders were the Maori, who hunted giant birds called moas. From there, the theory was confirmed that the Maori came from Polynesia and took New Zealand from the Moriori, forming a farming community. However, new evidence shows that the Moriori were a separate Maori clan that migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own unique culture, of peaceful living. There is a Maori clan on the Chatham Islands who migrated from New Zealand. They call themselves Moriori. There are other theories on the matter, the Moriori were the Maori.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Pureland origami shi ne origami da ƙuntatawan da akan iya nadi daya kawai a lokaci guda, ba a yarda da nadi mai wuya ba kamar nadin baya, da dukkan nadi suna da wurare kai tsaye. John Smith ya kirkiro shi a cikin shekarar 1970 don taimakon masu adana fayiloli da ba su da ƙwarewa ko waɗanda ke da kuntatacciyar damar motsi.
mt: Pureland origami is origami that can be folded in one time, not allowed to fold back, and all folds are in place. John Smith invented it in the 1970s for the help of file keepers who lack experience or those who have folding skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Wayewar-kai na Kwarin Indus wata wayewar-kai na Zamanin Tagulla ce a arewa maso yamma na ƙaramar nahiyar Indiya wadda ta ƙunshi yawancin ƙasar Pakista na zamanin yau da kuma wasu yankuna a cikin arewa maso yamma na Indiya da kuma arewa maso gabas na ƙasa Afganistan. Ci gaban wannan zamani ya bunkasa a kewayen kogin Indus ta inda ya samo sunansa. Koda yake wasu masana suna hasashen cewa tun da ci gaban zamanin ya wanzu a kwarin da kogin Sarasvati ya kafe, ya kamata a kira shi da ci gaban zamani na Indus-Sarasvati, yayin da wasu ke kiransa da ci gaban zamani na Haraffa, wato yankin da aka fara hakewa a shekarun 1920.

ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Son kai da zalama za su ci gaba da kasancewa da mu kuma tsarin hadin kai ne kawai zai amfani mutane yayin da ta hanyar nuna son rai kuma na dan karamin lokaci ne kawai za a ga gajiyar hakan. Fatan shi ne, mutane da dama su gane cewa a karshe za su fi samun moriya idan sun hada kansu da sauran jama’a.
mt: 1. People will continue to be with us and the only way to use people while showing good will and only in the short term will we see this. The point is, many people will realize that they will get more benefit if they join with other people.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Kuɗaɗen ɗaukar nauyin yaƙi na mulkin mallakar Amurka a yakin mallake Philippines mutanen Phillippines ne da kansu suka biya. An tilasta musu su biya haraji ga gwamnatin mulkin mallaka ta Amurka don biyan wani babban kaso na kudaden da aka kashe da kuma kuɗin-ruwa na kan basukan da aka fitar da sunan gwamnatin Philippines ta cikin bankunan Wall Street. Tabbas, babban ribar da aka samu daga kwarar da aka dade ana yi wa ‘yan Filifins ya zama shi ne tushen nasarar mallakar bayan yanci da Amurka ta samu.
mt: The Philippines paid for the cost of the war in the Philippine-American War. They were forced to pay taxes to the American government to pay for a large portion of the money spent and the cost of the waterways that were named after the government of the Philippines in the banks of Wall Street. In fact, the main profit that was gained from the long war was given to the Philippines as the source of the victory of independence and the United States.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Don fahimtar Templars dole ne mutum ya fahimci mahallin da ya haifar da ƙirƙirar tsari. Zamanin da al'amuran suka faru galibi ana masu lakabi da Mafi girmn Shekarun Tsakiya lokacin tarihin Turai a ƙarni na 11, 12, da 13th (AD 1000 - 1300). Babban Shekaru ta Tsakiya ya gabace Shakarun Tsakiyar Farko wanda Shakaru Tsakiyar Da Sun Gabata su ka bi, wanda a cikin babban taron ya gama kusan shekaru 1500.
mt: To understand Templars one must understand the location that gave rise to the order. The time period in which events occurred is often referred to as the High Middle Ages, during the history of Europe in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000 - 1300). The High Middle Ages followed the Early Middle Ages which in turn followed the Late Middle Ages, which ended around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Yanayin Roman empire da ke dauke da salon soja ya taimaka wajen ci gaba a fanni lafiya. Sarki Augustus ya fara daukar likitoci aiki inda har ya kafa Ƙungiyar Likitocin Rum ta farko domin anfani da ita bayan ƙare yaki. Likitocin fiɗa suna da ilimin magunguna daban-daban na kashe jiki wadanda suka hada da sinadarin morphine daga tsirrai da sikari da aka samo daga zirin herbane. Sun ƙware wajen yanke gaɓoɓi don kare masu ciwo daga ruɓewar sashen jiki da kuma kayan aikin matse jijiyoyi don tsayar da gudanar jini. A cikin ƙarnoni masu yawa, daular Rumawa ta ci riba a ɓangaren magunguna kuma ta samar da mafi yawancin ilimin da mu ka sani yanzu.
mt: Ƙungiyar Roman empire da ke dauke da salon soja ya taimaka wajen ci gaba a fanni lafiya. Sarki Augustus ya fara daukar likitoci aiki inda har ya kafa Ƙungiyar Likitocin Rum ta farko domin anfani da ita bayan ƙare yaki. Likitocin fiɗa suna da ilimin magunguna daban-daban na kashe jiki wadanda suka hada da sinadarin morphine daga tsirrai da sikari da aka samo daga zirin herbane. Sun ƙware wajen yanke gaɓoɓi don kare masu ciwo daga ruɓewar sashen jiki da kuma kayan aikin matse jijiyoyi don tsayar da gudanar jini. A cikin ƙarnoni masu yawa, daular Rumawa ta ci riba a ɓangaren magunguna kuma ta samar da mafi yawancin ilimin da mu ka sani yanzu.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Gani, ko ikon iya ganin ya dogara a kan hanyoyin gani na gabbai ko idanuwa. Akwai tsaruka daban-daban na yadda ido ke aiki, wanda su ka danganta da bukatuwar halitta. Kowane irin gini da irin nasa bukatun, kowanne da irin basirar da aka yi amfani wajen samar da shi, don haka kowanne da irin kayan aikin da ya ke bukata yadda a karshe zai bada ma’ana cikakkiya.
mt: 1. Gaze, or the ability to see depends on the pathways of the eye. There are different theories of how the eye works, which relate to the needs of the organism. Each type of eye has its own requirements, each use of the eye requires a particular tool, so each type of eye gives a complete meaning.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Sikhism addini ne daga yankin India. Ya samo asali ne daga yankin Punjab a lokacin karni na 15 daga rarrabuwa tsakanin mazhabobin Hindu. Mabiya addinin Sikh dai nadaukar kansu a matsayin masu bin wani addini na daban da addinin Hindu duk da cewa ma suna daukar addinin Hindun a zaman tushensu dama al’adarsu. Mutanen Sikh suna kiran addininsu Gurmat, wanda shine Punjabi don “hanyar Guru”. Guru shine muhimmin bangare na dukkanin addinan Indiya amma a cikin Sikhism ya ɗauki mahimmancin da ke samar da asalin abubuwan Sikh. An kafa adinin a karni na 15 ta Guru Nanak (1469 - 1539). Sannan a ka biyo da waɗanda suka ci gadon sarauta guda tara.
mt: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian subcontinent. It originated in the Punjab region in the 15th century from the teachings of Guru Nanak and ten successive Sikh gurus (spiritual guides). Sikhism is based on the teachings of its 10 gurus, which are compiled in the holy book Guru Granth Sahib. Sikhism is the fifth-largest organized religion in the world, with approximately 30 million adherents. Sikhism is the second-largest religion in India and the fifth-largest in the world by number of followers.
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: Ciwon Kasawar Hankali “cuta ce ta jijiyoyin wacce ta ke bayyana sa game da alamomin ciki har da rashin motsin jiki, daukan hnkali, da kuma kazar-kazar ko wuce haddi da tsananin kuzari”. Ba nakasa bane wajen koyo, rashin lafiya ne wurin koyo; yana “shafan kashi 3 zuwa 5 cikin dari na yara, kila kimanin miliyan 2 na yaran America”. Yara masu ADD suna fuskantar mawuyacin hali game da mayar da hankali akan ayyukan makaranta, amma zasu iya mayar da hankali kan abubuwan da suke so kamar su yiun wassani ko kallon shirin barkwancin da suka fi so ko rubuta jimloli ba tare da sa alamomin rubutu ba. Waɗannan yara sukan shiga cikin matsala mai yawa, saboda suna “shiga halaye masu haɗari, shiga faɗa, kuma suna ƙalubalantar hukuma” don haɓaka ƙwaƙwalwarsu, tunda kwakwalwar ba za ta iya motsa su ta hanyoyin yau da kullun ba. ADD yana shafar alaƙa da sauran takwarorinsu saboda wasu yara ba sa iya fahimtar abin da ya sa suke yin abin da suke yi ko kuma dalilin da ya sa suke yin rubutu kamar yadda suke yi ko kuma matakinsu na manya ya bambanta.

ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Duk da yake tushen koyo game da aiki yakamata ya sauƙaƙa ilmantarwa kuma ya zama mai ban sha'awa, ƙwanƙwasa aiki ya wuce mataki. Nannadewa ba hanya ce ta ilmantarwa ba amma taimako ne wanda ke bayar da tallafi ga mutanen da ke fuskantar sabon ƙwarewar ilmantarwa kamar amfani da sabon shirin komputa ko fara sabon aiki. Wuraren zartar da hukuncin na iya zama na gaske ko kuma holoko, ko kuma a wani kaulin, malami ka iya zama hakan, sai dai wani dan kankanin abu manhajar Microsoft Office. Ana saka kariya cikin manhajojin domin su yi tambaya, su yi nuni da bada bayanai wadanda dalibai su kadai ba za su iya fuskanta ba.
mt: While the source of the tutorial is supposed to be easy to understand and fun, the tutorial has gone over the heads of the students. Tutoring is not a way to learn, but a help that provides assistance to people who are facing new learning challenges such as using a new computer program or starting a new job. The location of the tutorial may be blank or a placeholder, or a teacher may be a placeholder, but a small part of the Microsoft Office suite. The tutorial is placed in the placeholders to ask questions, to point out and to provide information that students will not be able to face.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace shine shahararren gidan yanar gizo na uku mafi mashahuri a cikin Amurka kuma yana da bayanan martaba miliyan 54 a halin yanzu. Waɗannan sassan yanar gizon sun ja ra’ayi sosai, musamman a ɓangaren ilimi. Shafin yanar gizon na da amfani, wanda ya hada da damar bude wani shafin da zai kunshi, karamin shafin yanar gizo, hoto mai motsi da mara motsi da wasu abubuwan. Za a iya shiga wannan shafin cikin sauƙi ta hanyar samar da adireshin yanar-gizo guda daya kawai, wanda ya ke da sauƙin tunawa da kuma sauƙin rubutawa ga ɗaliban da za su iya samun matsala ta amfani da keyboard ko a cikin rubutawa daidai. Ana iya tsara shi domin saukin karantawa kuma tare da launi mai yawa ko launi kadan kamar yadda ake bukata.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular social networking site in the United States and has 54 million registered users. These pages are very popular, especially in the education field. The site has features, including the ability to create a new page that will contain, a small website, moving and non-moving images and other things. You can enter this site easily by creating a single email address, which is easy to remember and easy to write for students who may have difficulty using a keyboard or writing correctly.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: ko da yake, a watan Yuni ta 1956, an gwada alkawuran Krushchev a lokacin da tarzoma a Poland, inda ma'aikata ke zanga-zangar adawa da ƙarancin abinci da rage albashi, ta rikide zuwa zanga-zangar gama gari ta adawa da Kwaminisanci. Kodayake dai a ƙarshe, Kruschev ya aika da tankokin yaƙi don maido da zaman lafiya, amma ya amince da wasu buƙatun tattalin arziki da kuma naɗa mutumin nan mai farin jini wato Wladyslaw Gomulka a matsayin sabon firayin minista.
mt: However, in June 1956, Krushchev was tested during riots in Poland, where workers were striking against food shortages and price hikes, escalating into a nationwide protest against Communism.  Despite this, Kruschev sent in tanks to restore order, but also conceded to some economic demands and appointed the fiery Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Jamus abokiyar gabar kowa ce a Yakin Duniya ta 2, wanda hakan ta haifar da haɗin kai tsakanin Tarayyar Sobiyet da Amurka. Da ƙarewar yakin sai sabanin tsarin rayuwa, al’amura da al'adu ya jawo rabuwar kan ƙasashen. Tare da shekaru biyu na ƙarshen yaƙin, tsoffin maƙasudin yanzu abokan gaba ne kuma aka fara Yakin Sanyi. An tsara zai kai shekaru 40 masu zuwa kuma za ayi yaƙe shi a hakika,ta sojojin haya, a filayen yaƙi daga Africa zuwa Asia, a Afghanistan, Cuba da sauran wurare da dama.
mt: Germany was a major player in World War II, which led to the alliance of the Soviet Union and the United States. After the war, the old order was replaced by new ones, and the events and cultures led to the Cold War. With two years of the end of the war, the old enemies are now allies and the war began in the Cold War. It was designed to last 40 years and would be fought in fact, by proxy, in battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Tsarin Sadarwar Jiki (Nervous System) yana kula da daidaitun yanayin cikin jiki ta hanyar aika saƙonnin motsin jijiyoyi a gabadayan jiki don kula da yadda jini yake gudana ba tare da matsala ba. Ana iya turo waɗannan bugawar jijiya da wuri a dukkan jiki wanda hakan yake taimaka jikin ya zama da lafiya daga wani haɗari mai iya tasowa.
mt: The nervous system regulates the balance of fluids in the body by sending signals to the heart to pump blood without error. These signals can be sent to any part of the body, which helps the body stay healthy from a potential threat.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: Babban alwatikan a Giza shine kawai ɗayan abubuwan al'ajabi bakwai da har yanzu suke tsaye a yau. Babban Masarautar da Masarawa suka gina a ƙarni na uku KZ, Babban alwatika yana ɗayan manyan gine-ginen dala da aka gina don girmama Fir'auna da ya mutu. Giza Plateau, ko “Giza Necropolls” a Kwarin Massar na matattu yana kunshe da dala iri-iri ( wanda babban dala shine mafi girma), yawancin kananan kaburbura, gidajen bauta, da babban gunkin Sphinx. Babbar dalar an kafa ta ne domin girmama Fir’auna Khufu, kuma da daman cikinsu da kushewu da wuraren ibada an gina su ne domin matan Khufu tare da iyalan gidansa.
mt: 1 of the 7 wonders of the ancient world still standing today. The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the largest structures built for money, built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and the interior chambers and burial chambers were built for Khufu's wives and his family.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: An rushe Ɗakin bauta na Artemis a Ephesus a ranar 21 a Yuli, 356 BCE a cinna mashi wuta da Herostratus ya aikata. Kamar yadda labarin ya ce, abin da ya ba shi ƙwarin guiwa shi ne neman suna ta kowane hali. Afisawa, cikin fushi, suka ba da sanarwar cewa ba za a taɓa rubuta sunan Herostratus ba. Masanin tarihin Girka Strabo ya lura da sunan daga baya, wanda shine yadda muka sani a yau. An rusa gidan bautar a cikin daren da aka haifi Alexander the Great . Alexander a matsayin sa na sarki, ya ba da kuɗi don sake gina haikalin, amma ba a karɓi tayin nasa ba. Bayan haka, bayan Alexander ya mutu, aka sake gina haikalin a 323 KZ.
mt: 21 July 356 BCE, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was burned down by Herostratus in a fit of rage. As the story goes, his only skill was to be famous for any reason. Later, in a fit of pique, it was announced that the name of Herostratus would never be written again. Greek historian Strabo noted the name later, as we know it today. The temple was rebuilt in the day Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, donated money to rebuild the temple, but his offer was refused. After that, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: An rushe Ɗakin bauta na Artemis a Ephesus a ranar 21 a Yuli, 356 BCE a cinna mashi wuta da Herostratus ya aikata. Kamar yadda labarin ya ce, abin da ya ba shi ƙwarin guiwa shi ne neman suna ta kowane hali. Afisawa, cikin fushi, suka ba da sanarwar cewa ba za a taɓa rubuta sunan Herostratus ba. Masanin tarihin Girka Strabo ya lura da sunan daga baya, wanda shine yadda muka sani a yau. An rusa gidan bautar a cikin daren da aka haifi Alexander the Great . Alexander a matsayin sa na sarki, ya ba da kuɗi don sake gina haikalin, amma ba a karɓi tayin nasa ba. Bayan haka, bayan Alexander ya mutu, aka sake gina haikalin a 323 KZ.
mt: 21 July 356 BCE, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was burned down by Herostratus in a fit of rage. As the story goes, his only skill was to be famous for any reason. Later, in a fit of pique, it was announced that the name of Herostratus would never be written again. Greek historian Strabo noted the name later, as we know it today. The temple was rebuilt in the day Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, donated money to rebuild the temple, but his offer was refused. After that, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Hanyar sufuri ta farko da aka sani ita ce tafiya da ƙafa, mutane sun fara tafiya a miƙe shekaru miliyan biyu da suka gabata lokacin bayyanawar Homo Erectus (ma'ana miƙaƙƙen mutum). Magabatan su, Australopithecus ba su yi tafiya miƙe ba kamar yadda ya ke a ɗabi’ance. An sami kwarewar dabbobi masu tafiya da kafafu biyu a ƙasusuwan tarihi na Australopithecus daga shekaru miliyan 4.2-3.9 da suka shude, duk da cewa watakila Sahelanthropus sun yi tafiya da kafafu biyu tun wajen shekaru miliyan bakwai da suka gabata.
mt: The first known method of travel was walking, and people have been doing so since Homo Erectus (meaning upright man) appeared about two million years ago. Their predecessors, Australopithecus, did not walk upright as we do now. Evidence of bipedalism has been found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have been bipedal as early as seven million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Amfani da jirgin ruwa domin kwasan kayayyaki shine mafi inganci wajen kwasan mutane da yawa da kayayyaki ta teku. Ainihin aikin sojojin ruwa shine domin tabbatar cewa kasarka ta kula da iyawa domin motsa mutanenka da kayayyaki, yayinda kuma a lokaci daya, tsoma baki da kokarin da abokan gaba ke yi domin tafiyar da mutane da kayayyaki. Daya daga cikin fitattun misalai na kwana nan game da wannan shine gumurzun yankin Atlantika ta Arewa lokacin Yakin Duniya na biyu. Amurkawa suna ƙoƙarin jigilar da sojoji da kayan yaki zuwa ƙetarenTekun Atlantika don taimakawa Biritaniya. A lokaci daya, dakarun ruwa na Jamus, ta hanyar amfani da jirgin U-boats, na kokarin tsayar da wannan cinkoson. Da Sojan taron dangi ba su yi nasara ba, watakila da Jamus ta iya yi mamaye Biritaniya kamar ta sauran Turai.
mt: Using a ship to transport cargo is the most efficient way to move large numbers of people and goods across water. The actual military use of ships is to ensure that your country is in control of the seas, while at the same time, other countries are trying to do the same. One of the most famous examples of this is the Battle of the Atlantic during World War II. The Americans were trying to transport troops and weapons to Britain. At the same time, the Germans were trying to disrupt this effort using U-boats. Neither side was successful, but Germany may have been able to conquer Britain as it did the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Kegawar sandar linzamin ya sa kurasain Assiriyawa ya zama da rashin nauyi, sauri da kuma sun shirya da kyau domin su fi sojoji gudu da wasu kurasain. Kibiyoyinsu masu hadari da ake harbawa na iya fasa kariyar sojojin abokan gaba. Wajajen shekaru 1000 B.C.kafin zuwan annabi Musa yan Asiriya su ka kirkiri sojojin dawaki. Sojan dawakai su ne rundunar sojan da ke yaƙi kan dawakai. Ba a ƙirƙiro sirdi a lokacin ba, don haka sojan dawakai na Assiriyawa sun yi yaƙi a kan tsuran bayan dawakan su.
mt: 1,000 B.C. before the coming of Moses, the Assyrians created a standing army. The standing army was the infantry. The infantry was the Assyrian army. No cavalry was invented at the time, so the Assyrian infantry fought on foot.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Yan Babylon sun gina wa kowanne allansu haikali da ya zama matsayin gidan allan. Mutane za su kawo hadaya ga abubuwan bauta yayin da malaman bautar za su yi ƙoƙarin biyan buƙatun abubuwan bautar ta hanyar bukukuwa da shagulgula. Kowane wajen bauta tana da budaden haraba tare da kebantaccen mihrabi wanda limamai kadai ke shiga. Wasu lokuta an gina hasumiya na musamman mai siffar dala, wanda ake kira ziggurats, domin su zama sashi na haikali. Saman hasumiyar wuri ne na musamman na abun bautan.
mt: Babylonians built a temple for each of their gods. People would bring offerings to the temple while priests would attempt to fulfill the temple's needs through festivals and sacrifices. Each temple had a treasury with a vaulted ceiling that only priests could enter. Sometimes a special tower shaped like a ziggurat was built to be the temple's pinnacle. The top of the tower was a special place of worship.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Haka ne! Sarki Tutankhamun, wani lokaci ana kiransa “Sarki Tut” ko “Yaron Sarki”, ɗayan sanannun sarakunan Masar ne a zamanin yau. Abin sha'awa, ba a ɗauke shi da muhimmanci sosai a zamanin da ba kuma ba a rubuce shi a cikin jerin sunayen tsoffin sarakuna ba. Ko da yake, ganowar kabarin sa a 1922 ya maida shi shahararre. Yayin da kaburbura na baya suka fuskanci barazanan sata, an bar kabarin sa ba tare da hargitse shi ba. Mafi yawan abubuwan da aka binne Tutankhamun da su basu rube ko lalace ba, ciki har da dubban kayan kawa wadanda aka samar daga duwatsu masu daraja da wadansu duwatsu da babu irinsu.
mt: Indeed! King Tutankhamun, sometimes called "King Tut" or "The Boy King", was one of the most famous pharaohs of ancient Egypt. He was not particularly important in his own time and was not included in the list of kings. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him famous. While other tombs faced the ravages of time, his tomb was left undisturbed. Most of the objects buried with Tutankhamun were intact or damaged, including thousands of artifacts from the most elaborate funerary equipment ever found.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Mun san ‘yan siyasa. masana kimiyya da kuma masu nishaɗantarwa na Girka da dama. Mai yiwuwa mafi shaharar mutum a wannan al’ada shi ne Homer, fitaccen mawakin nan makaho, wanda ya rubuta fitattun ayyukan adabin Greek biyu: waƙoƙin Iliad da Odyssey. Sophocles da Aristophanes har yanzu shahararrun marubutan wasan kwaikwayo ne kuma ana ganin wasannin su suna daga cikin manyan ayyukan adabin duniya. Wani sanannen Bagirke mai ilimin lissafin Pythagoras, an san shi da fitacen dabara mai zurfin sa dangane ga dangantakar kusuryoyin alwatikar.
mt: We know politicians. scientists and also commentators of Greek and many. The most famous person in this tradition is Homer, the great poet of the epic, who wrote the famous works of Greek literature two: the Iliad and the Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still famous playwrights and their plays are considered among the greatest works of literature. A famous Greek mathematician Pythagoras, is known for his deep work based on the relationship of musical intervals.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: A cikin yanayi mai zafi na Gabas ta tsakiya, gida ba shi da matuƙar mahimmanci. Yawancin rayuwar dangin Ibrananci sun faru ne a sararin sama. Mata sun yi girki a farfajiyar; shagunan buɗe ido ne kawai suna kallon titi. An yi amfani da dutse don gina gidaje. Babu wani daji mai girma a ƙasar Kan'ana, saboda haka katako yana da tsada.
mt: In the hot climate of the Middle East, housing is not a high priority. Most of the lives of the Jewish families take place in the open air. Women are busy in the courtyard; the windows are only open to look at the street. Stone is used to build houses. There is no large forest in the country of Canaan, so the wood is scarce.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: An zauna a Greenland a warwatse. A cikin yankin Norse sun ce an kori Erik the Red daga Iceland saboda kisan kai, kuma lokacin da ya kaɗa ya yi yamma, sai ya gano Greenland kuma ya ba ta suna Greenland. Amma duk da ganowar sa, dama tuni ƙabilun Eskimo suna zaune a wurin a lokacin. Kodayake kowace ƙasa ta kasance 'Scandinavia', akwai bambance-bambance masu yawa tsakanin mutane, sarakuna, al'adu da tarihin Denmark, Sweden, Norway da Iceland.
mt: Greenland is in the midst of a heat wave. In the Norse area, they say Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when he landed he went west, and found Greenland and named it Greenland. But despite his discovery, the Eskimo people have been living there all along. Though each country is "Scandinavia", there are many differences between the people, kings, cultures and histories of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Duk da yake yawancin abincinsu zai zama sananne gare mu, Romawa suna da nasu yankin na baƙin bukukuwa ko abubuwan biki da ba a saba da su ba, da suka haɗa da akuyar daji, dawisu, dodon-koɗi, da kuma wani nau’in ɓera da ake kira dormousee Wani banbamcin kuma shi ne talakawa da kuma mata sun cinye abincinsu yayin da suke zaune a kan kujeru, masu hannu da shuni kuma suna son cin abinci tare a inda suke zama a manya-manyan dakunan shakatawa domin cin abincin. Cikin abubuwan da ake ci a tsohuwar daular Rum, ba zai kasance abincin da ya zo Turai daga Amurka ba ko kuma daga Asia a karnonin da su ka zo daga baya. Alal misali, ba su da masara, babu tumatur, babu dankali. babu koko, kuma babu mutumin tsohuwar Rum da ya taɓa ɗanɗana talotalo.
mt: While most of our food will be familiar to us, the Romans had their own area of the marketplace or festival items that were not common, including acorns, chestnuts, hazelnuts, and a type of rodent called dormice. A delicacy and also the poor and women would steal their food while they were sitting on benches, hands and feet and wanted to eat together in the large entertainment halls for food. Among the things eaten in the old Roman Empire, it will not be food that came to Europe from America or Asia in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, there was no tomato, there was no chili. There was no oak, and there was no person from the old Roman Empire who had ever tasted vanilla.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Duk da yake yawancin abincinsu zai zama sananne gare mu, Romawa suna da nasu yankin na baƙin bukukuwa ko abubuwan biki da ba a saba da su ba, da suka haɗa da akuyar daji, dawisu, dodon-koɗi, da kuma wani nau’in ɓera da ake kira dormousee Wani banbamcin kuma shi ne talakawa da kuma mata sun cinye abincinsu yayin da suke zaune a kan kujeru, masu hannu da shuni kuma suna son cin abinci tare a inda suke zama a manya-manyan dakunan shakatawa domin cin abincin. Cikin abubuwan da ake ci a tsohuwar daular Rum, ba zai kasance abincin da ya zo Turai daga Amurka ba ko kuma daga Asia a karnonin da su ka zo daga baya. Alal misali, ba su da masara, babu tumatur, babu dankali. babu koko, kuma babu mutumin tsohuwar Rum da ya taɓa ɗanɗana talotalo.
mt: While most of our food will be familiar to us, the Romans had their own area of the marketplace or festival items that were not common, including acorns, chestnuts, hazelnuts, and a type of rodent called dormice. A delicacy and also the poor and women would steal their food while they were sitting on benches, hands and feet and wanted to eat together in the large entertainment halls for food. Among the things eaten in the old Roman Empire, it will not be food that came to Europe from America or Asia in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, there was no tomato, there was no chili. There was no oak, and there was no person from the old Roman Empire who had ever tasted vanilla.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Wayewa al’ada ce guda wadda mutane da dama da ke zama da aiki tare na daukan nasu ce, al’umma. Kalmar civilization ta zo ne daga kalmar latin civilis, ma’ana farar hula, mai dangantaka da civis na Latin, ma’ana yan kasa, da cavitas, ma’ana birni ko birnin-jiha, kuma yana ba da adadin yawan jama’a. Biranen gari sune kashin bayan al'ummomi. Al'adar wayewar tana nuna wucewar ilimi a cikin tsararraki da yawa, rabe-raben al'adu da rarraba gaskiya. kananun al’adu galibi su kan shuɗe ba tare da barin tabbatattun shaidu na tarihi ba kuma ba a saka su cikin jerin manyan zamunna.
mt: 1. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning "polite", "civic", and "citified", and civis, meaning "citizen", and civitas, meaning "city", and gives the number of people. City centers are the backbones of civilizations. The process of civilization shows the progress of knowledge in many breakthroughs, the division of cultures and the real distribution. The cultures are usually on the rise without leaving the necessary historical records and are not included in the list of major civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong tsohon birni ne da ya rushe wanda akwai wajen bautar Buddha da ke sashi mai nisa na gundumar Paro (a ƙauyen Phondey). An ce a shekarar 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel ya kirkiri sansanin soja don tunawa da nasarar da ya samu a kan sojojin Tibet-Mongol. A shekarar 1951, wutar da ta tashi domin zama wata shaidar Drukgyal Dzong ya ci gaba da wanzuwa, kamar hotunan Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Bayan wutar, an kiyaye sansanin soja da kariya, ya kasance ɗaya da cikin abubuwan jan hankali na Bhutan.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong was an abandoned town that contains a ruined fortress on a hill above the village of Paro (in the district of Phondey). It was said in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel founded a military fort to commemorate his victory over the Tibetan-Mongol army. In 1951, a bomb exploded to become a landmark of Drukgyal Dzong continued to exist, as photographs of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the bomb, the military fort was preserved and protected, it was one of the attractions of Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: A ƙarni na 18 Cambodia ta sami kanta a matse tsakanin karfafan maƙwabta biyu, Thailand da Vietnam. Ƴan Thailand sun mamaye Cambodia sau da yawa a ƙarni na 18 inda a shekarar 1772 suka rusa Phnom Phen. Shekaru da suka gabata na karni 18 ‘yan Vietnam sun mamaye Cambodia.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was caught between two warring neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. Thailand invaded Cambodia in 1772 and captured Phnom Penh. In the previous decades of the 18th century, Vietnam had occupied Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: A ƙarni na 18 Cambodia ta sami kanta a matse tsakanin karfafan maƙwabta biyu, Thailand da Vietnam. Ƴan Thailand sun mamaye Cambodia sau da yawa a ƙarni na 18 inda a shekarar 1772 suka rusa Phnom Phen. Shekaru da suka gabata na karni 18 ‘yan Vietnam sun mamaye Cambodia.

src: Farkon Taiwan ya faro tun baya cikin karni na 15 inda Turawa matukan jirgin ruwa da ke wucewa suka ɗauki sunan tsibirin a matsayin IIha Formosa, ko kyakyawan tsibiri. A cikin 1624, Kamfanin Dutch East India Company ya kafa tushe a kudu maso yammacin Taiwan, yana ƙaddamar da canji a cikin ayyukan noman hatsi na asali da ɗaukar ma'aikata na China don yin aiki a gonakin shinkafa da sukari. A shekarar 1683, sojojin daular Qing (1644-1912) sun kwace ikon lardin Taiwan na yammacin da arewacin gabar teku, suka ayyana Taiwan a matsayin lardin daular Qing a shekarar 1885. A shekarar 1895, bayan kayarwa a cikin Farkon Yaƙin Sino-Japanese (1894-1895), gwamnatin Qing su sa-hannu a Yarjejeniyar Shimonoseki, ta wanda ta bayar da mulkin kan Taiwan zuwa ga Japan, wanda ya yi mulkin tsibirin har 1945.
mt: Taiwan was first discovered in the 15th century when European ships passing through the area took the name of the island as Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a settlement in southwestern Taiwan, initiating changes in the island's original rice cultivation and taking Chinese laborers to work in sugar and tea plantations. In 1683, Qing Dynasty (1644-1912) troops seized control of Taiwan's western and eastern coastal areas, declaring Taiwan a province of the Qing Dynasty in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government agreed to the terms of the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded control of Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
