src: Ana kiran wannan Chemical pH. Za ka iya saka alama ta amfani da ruwan jan kabeji. Lemun kabeji na canza launin bisa yanayin yawan acid ko alkaline din ma’adanin. Ana nuna matakin pH ta hanyar yawan sinadarin Hydrogen (na H a cikin pH) kwayoyin dake cikin sunadaran da aka gwada. Sinadiran Hydrogen sune proton wadanda suka cire wa Electrons (tunda sunadaran Hydrogen sun kunshi proton daya da electron daya).
mt: This is called Chemical pH. You can test it with litmus paper. Litmus paper changes color depending on the acidity or alkalinity of the sample. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (H in pH) ions present in the tested substance. Hydrogen ions are protons that have lost an electron (since Hydrogen ions contain one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Zakuna ne dangin mage da suka fi daɗin ma’amala, suna taruwa wuri ɗaya abin da ake kira iko. Garken zaki sun kunshi maza manya daya zuwa uku masu dangantaka, tare da mata da dama har zuwa talatin tare da ‘ya’ya. Mata yawanci suna da kusanci da juna, kasancewa babban dangi na yan uwa da 'ya'ya mata. Taruwar zakuna suna kamar rukunin kyar ko karnuka, dabbobi wanda suka yi kamar da zaki (amma ba sauran manyan kuliyoyi ba) a cikin hali, kuma suna da matukar cutarwa ga abincin su.
mt: Zakuna are extended families, living together in a compound. A zaki consists of a man and his wives, with their children. Wives are usually related to the husband, being his sisters, daughters, or cousins. A zaki is like a herd or flock, with the zaki (but not other large animals) living in a huddle, and are very susceptible to disease.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Karkashin su akwai wasu maguna masu matsakaicin yanayi wadanda ke cin abinci mai madaidaicin yanayi wanda ya fara daga zomaye zuwa barewa da barewan daji. Da karshe, akwai kananan kyanwoyi (da suka haɗa da kyanwoyin gida da suka gudu) da suke cin kananan naman da suka kama kamar kwari, ɓeraye, kadangaru, da tsuntsaye. Sirrin nasararsu ita ce tsarinsu na samun hutu, aiki na musamman da kowace kyanwa ke riko da shi domin kaucewa yin gasa da sauran.
mt: Underneath them are other omnivores that eat a balanced diet that ranges from insects to birds. Finally, there are small mammals (including house mice and rats) that eat small prey such as worms, beetles, crickets, and birds. Their success is their ability to find food, specialized work, and each individual breaks it down to avoid competition with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: 'Yan wasa suna son cin kananan dabbobi. Za su kama birai, macizai, zazzage da tsuntsaye in sun iya. Kusan dukkan dabbobin da dutsen ya farauto suna ƙasa da shi. Masana ilimin kimiyya suna tunanin cewa ocelots na bin dabbobi da kama su ta hanyar sansanar sawun inda su ka bi su ka wuce. Suna iya gani sosai cikin duhu tare da ganin na dare, kuma suna tafiya cikin sanɗa. Kyanwar daji na farautar abin farautar su ta hanyar sajewa da wurin da su ke sannan su dirar wa abin farautar su.
mt: The animals are after small prey. They will catch rabbits, squirrels, birds and other small animals if they can. Almost all the animals that the forest is home to are smaller than it. Scientists believe that ocelots are after animals and catch them by stalking them where they are. They are very good at seeing in the dark with their night vision, and they move in the shadows. The forest is home to the animals that the forest is home to.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Mai gudu sosai, damisa zai iya hawa (amma ba maikyau ba) yi iwo, tsalen nesa sosai da kuma ja so biya kamar kafin mutum. Damisar Tiger tana cikin rukuni guda (Genus Panthera) kamar zakuna, damisar leopards, da jaguars. Wadannan dangin kyanwar guda huɗu sune kaɗai su ke iya ruri. Rurin damisa bai yi kama da cikeke ƙarfin murya zaki ba, amma ya fi kama da gurnani na jimlar kalmomin da aka faɗa da ƙarfi.
mt: A roaring, growling, hissing, and spitting tiger is in a group (Genus Panthera) with leopards and jaguars. These four species are the only ones that can roar. Roaring does not involve the vocal cords, but is more like the hissing of a snake.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Kwayar hallita ita kashin tsari da kuma mai aiki mafi ƙarami na wani hallita (abubuwa) mai rai. kalmar Cell ta samo asali ne daga Latin wacce ke nufin karamin daki. Idan ka kalli abubuwa masu rai ta ƙarƙashin madubin makuroskof, za ka ga cewa abubuwa ne ƙanana masu kusurwa huɗu. Robert Hooke, masanin ilimin halittu daga Ingila, ya ga ƙananan murabba'ai a cikin abin toshe kwalaba tare da microscope. Suna kama da ɗakuna. Shi ne mutum na farko da ya lura da matattun ƙwayoyin halittaa
mt: A cell is the basic structural, functional, and biological unit of all known living organisms. The word cell comes from the Latin cellula, meaning "small room". Cells are the smallest units of structure that can carry out all of life's biochemical processes. They consistently exhibit the properties of life, such as responding to stimuli, reproduction, and metabolism. The structure of these individual cells is fundamentally similar, but may differ in shape and size, depending on the organism. Cells are classified into two groups, prokaryotic and eukaryotic, which both differ in their genetic material, in their internal parts and in their internal organization. Prokaryotes, such as bacteria, are single-celled organisms with no nucleus. Eukaryotic cells are complex, and are found in all higher life forms, such as animals, plants, fungi, and protists. The nucleus is a membrane-bound organelle that houses the DNA and directs cellular activities.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: An halici dabobi ne ta kwayoyin hallita dayawa. Suna cin abubuwa kuma su sarrafa su a ciki. yawanci dabobi na iya motsi. Dabbobi ne kawai ke da kwakwalwa (kodayake ba duk dabbobi ke da shi ba; misali, jellyfish, misali, ba su da kwakwalwa). Ana samun dabobi a ko in a doran kasa. suna tona kasa, iyo a cikin ruwa, da kuma tashi a sama.
mt: Cells are the basic units of life. They eat and absorb nutrients. Most cells can move. Cells are the only things that have nuclei (although not all cells have them; for example, jellyfish, for example, do not have nuclei). Cells are found in all parts of the body. They live in water, and they can fly.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Shuke-shuke suna sanya iskar oxygen wanda mutane ke shaka, kuma suna shan iskar carbon-dioxide wanda mutane ke fitarwa (ma'ana fitar da iska). Tsire-tsire suna yin abincinsu daga rana ta hanyar hotuna. Suna kuma bayar da inuwa. Muna gina gidajenmu ne daga itatuwa kuma muna yin sitirunmu daga itatuwa. Mafi yawan abincin da muke ci daga tsirrai ne. Idan babu tsirrai, mutane da dabbobi ba za su rayu ba.
mt: We breathe in oxygen that people exhale, and exhale carbon dioxide that people inhale (meaning exhale air). We eat our food through our mouths. We also provide shelter. We build our homes from clay and make our bricks from clay. Most of the food we eat comes from crops. If there are no crops, people and animals will not survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Yayin da wani karamin gungun dabbobi (jama’a kadan) su ka kasance sun rabu da babban gungun da su ke ciki (misali idan su ka koma kan wasu jerin tsaunuka, ko wani kogi ko kuma su ka koma wani sabon tsibirin yadda ba zasu iya komowa ba) akasari su kan sami kansu a muhalli na daban da inda su ka fito. Wannan sabon muhallin yana da albarkatu daban da kuma masu gasa daban, don haka sabuwar al’umma za ta buƙaci mabambantan fasali ko karɓuwa don zama ƙaƙƙarfar mai gasafiye da abin da su ka buƙata a baya. Asalin al’umman basu canza ba ko kadan, suna bukatan karbuwa kamar da. A kan lokaci, yayin da sabbin yawan jama’a suka fara daidaita da sabon yanayin su, sai su fara dawo kadan da kadan kamar waɗancan yawan jama'a. A ƙarshe, bayan dubun dubbai ko ma shekaru miliyoyi, yawar jama’a biyu za su zauna da banbancin da ba za a kira su da wannan jinsin ba. Samar da sabon jinsi, hanya ce mai mahimmanci wadda ba za’a iya kauce mata ba a cikin tsarin asalin halittu.
mt: 1. A small group of individuals (a few) will split off from the main group (e.g. if they move to another mountain range, or a river, or to another island, where they cannot return) and will find themselves in a new environment. This new environment will have different resources and different challenges, so the new population will need to adapt or adopt new traits or behaviors to survive in the new environment. The original population will not change or adapt, they will just continue as they were. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to the new environment, they will begin to resemble the original population more and more. Eventually, after thousands of years or millions of years, the two populations will be indistinguishable from each other. Creating a new species, is just one way that evolution works.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Babban mahimmin tsarin magudanar jini shine zuciya, wacce ke harba jini. Jini na fitowa daga zuciya ta hanyoyin da ake kira arteries sannan ya na komawa cikin zuciya ta hanyoyin da ake kira veins. Mafikan kantar wadannan hanyoyi su ake kira da capillaries.
mt: The main circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart through arteries and returns through veins. The smallest of these vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Babban mahimmin tsarin magudanar jini shine zuciya, wacce ke harba jini. Jini na fitowa daga zuciya ta hanyoyin da ake kira arteries sannan ya na komawa cikin zuciya ta hanyoyin da ake kira veins. Mafikan kantar wadannan hanyoyi su ake kira da capillaries.

ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Kwari ne dabbobin da suka fara tashi cikin iska. Iya tashin su ya taimaka musu wajen kauce wa abokan gaba cikin sauki kuma su sami abinci da yin barnara sosai. Yawancin kwari suna da fa'idar kasancewa suna iya ninke fuka-fukansu su mayar jikin su. Wannan kan ba su faffaɗan fage na kananan wurare da za su iya boyewa daga mafarauta. A yau, kwarin kawai da ba za su iya linke fikafikan su ba sune kudan diragon da mayflies.
mt: The insects that first take to the air. They can help us safely avoid collisions and find food and shelter. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fly away from predators. Today, only the mosquitoes and mayflies are the only insects that cannot fly.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Yawancin masana burbushin halittu a yau sunyi imanin cewa ƙungiyar dinosaur daya ta rayu kuma tana raye a yau. Muna kiran su tsuntsaye. Mutane da yawa basa tunanin cewa suna daga cikin halitun dinosaurs saboda suna da fiffike kuma suna iya tashi sama. Amma akwai wasu abubuwa game da tsuntsuye dake kama da na dinosaur. Suna da ƙafafu masu gurji-gurji da fartuna, suna yin ƙwai, kuma suna tafiya kan ƙafafunsu biyu na baya kamar wani T-Rex.
mt: Most modern birds are thought to be descendants of dinosaurs and are still alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think they are related to dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are some things about birds that are like dinosaurs. They have claws, they poop, and they walk on their hind legs like a T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Hakoran triceratops za su iya taune ba kawai ganye ba har ma da tsauraran rassa da saiwoyi. Wasu masana kimiyya suna tunanin Triceratops ne ya ci Cycads, wanda nau'in tsirrai ne wanda aka saba da shi a cikin Cretaceous. Wadannan tsirrai suna kama da kananan bishiyar kwakwa da rawanin kaifi, ganyaye masu suka. Triceratops na amfani da bakin sa mai karfi don cire ganyen kafin cin bawon. Wasu masana kimiyyar sun kawo hujjar cewa waɗannan tsirrai suna ɗauke da guba don haka zai yi wuya a ce kakannin ƙadangare na cin su, koda yake yanzu sloth da sauran dabbobi kamar aku (jikokin kakannin ƙadangare) su kan ci ganyaye ko yayan itace masu guba.
mt: Triceratops teeth would have been able to cut through not only vegetation but also tough stems and leaves. Some paleontologists have suggested that these plants may have been toxic, making it difficult for the ancestors of modern sloths and other animals such as aukus (the ancestors of modern sloths) to eat them, even though they now eat toxic plants or their fruits.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Masu kwallon ƙafa ta ƙasar Italiya, tare da ƙungiyar ƙwallon ƙafa ta ƙasar Jamus ita ce ta biyu mafi nasara a duniya kuma sun kasance zakarun ƙwallon ƙafa na FIFA a 2006. Shahararrun wasanni sun hada da kwallon kafa, kwallon kwando, wasan kwallon raga, wasan ruwa, wasan takobi, wasan kwallon rugby, tseren kekuna, kwallon gora, wasan kwallon gorar kankara da na tseren motoci na F1. Wasannin hunturu sun shahara a yankuna na Arewa, inda da Italiyawa su ke fafatawa a wasannin kasa da kasa da wasannin Olympic.
mt: Italy, with the national football team, is the second most successful in the world and was the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Notable sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, swimming, track and field, rugby union, tennis, ice hockey, boxing, cycling, skiing, and Formula One. Winter sports are popular in the northern regions, where Italy competes in international competitions and the Olympics.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxembourg tana da dogon tarihi amma samin independenceancinta ya samo asali ne daga 1839. A yau sassan kasar Belgium, a baya sun kasance ɓangare ne na Luxembourg wadanda a lokacin juyin juya hali na shekarun 1830 su ka komo Belgium. Luxembourg kodayaushe ta kan yi kokarin kasancewarta ƙasa ‘yar ba-ruwanmu amma Jamus ta mamaye ta a yaƙin Duniya na Ɗaya da Yaƙin Duniya na Biyu. A shekarar 1957 Luxembourg ta zama ɗaya daga membobin da suka kafa ƙungiyar da aka sani yanzu da suna European Union.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence was founded in 1839. Today parts of Belgium, previously part of Luxembourg, separated from Belgium during the Belgian Revolution of the 1830s. Luxembourg is still trying to be a neutral country but Germany occupied it during World War I and World War II. In 1957 Luxembourg became one of the founding members of the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

mt: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence was founded in 1839. Today parts of Belgium, previously part of Luxembourg, separated from Belgium during the Belgian Revolution of the 1830s. Luxembourg is still trying to be a neutral country but Germany occupied it during World War I and World War II. In 1957 Luxembourg became one of the founding members of the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Turkiyyar Turai (wato gabashin Thrace ko Rumelia da ke cikin sashen tsibirin Balkan) ya kunshi kashi 3% ne na ƙasar. Faɗin ƙasar Turkiyya ya kai tsawon kilomita 1,600 (mil 1,000) da kuma faɗin kilomita 800 (mil 500), mai shatin kusurwoyi guda huɗu. Yankin Turkiyya, wanda ya hada da tabkuna, ya mamaye murabba'in murabba'in kilomita 783,562 (300,948 sq mi), wanda murabba'in murabba'in kilomita 755,688 (kilomita 291,773) yana kudu maso yammacin Asiya da kuma murabba'in murabba’in kilomita 23,764 (9,174 sq mi) a Turai. Faɗin yankin Turkiyya ya sanya ta kasance ƙasa ta 37 mafi girma a duniya, ta kai girman ƙasashen Faransa da Birtaniya a hade. Kasar turkiya ta yi iyaka da tekuna guda uku, wato Tekun Aegean a yamma, da Bakin teku a arewa sai kuma na Bahar rum a kudanci.
mt: 3% of the country is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula). The total area of Turkey is 783,562 km² (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 km² (291,773 sq mi) is in Asia and 23,764 km² (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. The area of Turkey is the 37th largest in the world, making it larger than France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey borders three seas, the Aegean Sea in the west, the Black Sea in the north and the Mediterranean Sea in the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Yawan al’ummar Birnin Vatican ya kai kimanin mutane 800. Ita ce kasa mafi kankanta cikin kasashe masu yancin kansu kuma mafi karancin yawan jama’a. Fadar Vatican tana amfani da harshen Italiya a dokoki da kuma sadarwar hukuma. Yaren Italiyanci kuma yare ne na yau da kullun da yawancin waɗanda ke aiki a cikin jihar ke amfani dashi yayin da ake amfani da Latin a cikin bukukuwan addini. Dukkan al’ummar Fadar Vatican ‘yan Dariƙar Katolika ne.
mt: 800 people live in the Vatican City, the smallest country in freedom and the lowest population. The Vatican uses Italian in official documents and in the Vatican, Italian is the common language used by most of the people working in the state, while Latin is used in religious ceremonies. All the citizens of the Vatican are Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: A zamanin yanzu ana amfani da kwamfutoci wajen jirkita hotuna da bidiyoyi. Zane-zane masu kayatarwa za a iya samun su a kwamfutoci, kuma irin wadannan zane-zanen suna ci gaba da samun karbuwa a telebijin da finafinai. Ana yin rikodin waƙoƙi sau da yawa ta amfani da ƙwararrun kwamfutoci don sarrafawa da haɗa sautuka tare.
mt: 3D printers are used to create images and videos. These images can be found on 3D printers, and these images are still gaining popularity on televisions and movies. Songs are often recorded using professional 3D printers to mix and match voices.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Biranen Harappa da Mohenjo-daro suna da banɗaki mai ruwa a kusan kowane gida, wanda su ke haɗe wani kyakkyawa tsarin magudanar najasa. An samo ragowar tsarin shara a gidajen biranen Minoan na Crete da Santorini da ke Girka. Hakanan akwai bandakuna a zamanin d Misira, Farisa da China. A cikin wayewar Roman, wasu lokuta bayan gida wani bangare ne na gidajen wanka na jama'a inda maza da mata suke tare a cikin haɗin gwiwa.
mt: The Harappa and Mohenjo-daro sites have water channels in almost every house, which are connected to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of the system have been found in the Minoan palaces of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There are also channels in the ancient Egyptian, Persian and Chinese civilizations. In the Roman era, some cases after the house a part is a public well where men and women are together in a cooperative.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Karfe da ke kan takalman zamani na wasa a kankara na da baki biyu da buɗaɗɗen rami tsakanin su. Gefen biyun suna ba da izini don kyakkyawan kamu kankaran, koda kuwa an goge shi. Saboda wukar ta dan lankwashe daga kasanta, yayinda wajen kaifin ya karkace dag nan zuwa can, tsinin wanda ya taba kankarar shi ma ya dan lankwashe. Wannan yana sa skater ya juya. Idan skates suka yi hagu zuwa dama, skater din tayi dama, idan skates dinsu yi hagu zuwa hagu, skater din sai ya juya hagu.
mt: 2 skaters are in close proximity with a gap between them. Both skaters are giving each other room. Due to the friction of the skate on the ice, the ice in front of the skater is pushed forward. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates go to the right, the skater goes to the right, if the skates go to the left, the skater goes to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Don komowa kan matakin makamashinsu irin na baya, dole sai sun kawar da ƙarin makamashin da suka samu daga haske. Suna yin wannan ta hanyar sakin wani ɗan ƙaramin hasken wuta da ake kira “photon”. Masana kimiyya suna kiran wannan tsarin “rurar watsin haskaka” domin ana rura ƙwayar zarra ta hanyar wuta mai haske, wanda ke sa watsin hasken foton, da haske wata iri haskakawa ne. Hoto na gaba yana nuna kwayan zarra masu fitar da photons. Hakika, a zahiri photons sunfi yawa akan waɗanda suke cikin hoton. Photons suna da kankanci fiye da abin da ke kunshe cikin atom!
mt: To get back to where we were before, they had to cancel out the extra photons they got from the light. They do this by emitting a small amount of light called a “photon”. Scientists call this process “photon sorting” because they sort the cells by emitting light, which is a type of photon. The picture above shows a cell emitting photons. In reality, there are many more photons than are shown in the picture! Photons have a lot of energy compared to what is contained in an atom!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Bayan aiki na ɗaruruwan sa’o’i a ƙarshe sai zaren haske da ke cikin ƙwan fitilar ya ƙone daga nan ƙwan fitilar ya daina aiki. Kwan fitilan lantarkin na bukatan canzawa. Yana da muhimmanci ayi la’akari wurin canza kwan fitilan. Farko, ya kamata a kashe matatsar wutan ko kuma katse hadin wayan kebur din. Wannan saboda wutan lantarki da ke shigan socket a inda karfe na jikin kwan fitila ke zaune na iya baka rawar jiki mai tsanani idan ka taba cikin socket ko karfe na kwan fitilan yayinda yake hade da socket.
mt: After several minutes of operation, the red light in the fuse box turned off and the fuse box stopped working. The fuse box is faulty. It is important to consider the replacement of the fuse box. First, it is necessary to cut the power supply or disconnect the power supply. This is because the fuse box and the socket where the fuse box is located may be damaged if you touch the socket or the fuse box while it is connected to the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Bam mai tarwatsewa yana aiki ne akan ƙa’idar cewa yana zukar kuzari domin ya dunkule yayan kwayar zarra na protons da neutrons a tsakiyar kwayar zarrar. Kamar gangara babban keke zuwa tudu. Tsage tsakiya kuma sannan ya saki wasu daga cikin wannan kuzari. Wasu kwayar zarra suna da nuclei mai canzawa wanda ya nuna cewa suna iya rabewa da ‘yar ƙarfafawa ko babu .
mt: The beam is working by assuming that it is colliding head-on with the protons and neutrons in the center of the proton beam. Like a giant battering ram. The center then bounces back and releases some of this collision. Some of the proton beams have nuclei that show that they can split into daughter or no.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Lokacin da kuka kira wanda yake da nisan duban mil kuna amfani da tauraron dan adam. Tauraron dan adam a sararin samaniya yana samun kira sannan yana nuna shi baya ƙasa, kusan nan take. An aika tauraron dan adam zuwa sararin samaniya ta hanyar roka. Masana kimiyya suna amfani da madubin hangen nesa a sararin samaniya saboda yanayin duniya yana gurbata wasu haskenmu da kallo. Yana daukan katon kunbo fiye da tsawon kafa 100 domin sanya tauraron dan adam ko abin kawo nesa kusa a sararin sama.
mt: When you call someone who is a few miles away you use radio waves. Radio waves in the atmosphere show up as a line behind the person you are calling. Radio waves are sent to the atmosphere by bouncing them off a satellite. Scientists use radio waves in the atmosphere because the world's atmosphere is interfering with other forms of light. It takes about 100 seconds for a radio wave to travel from the satellite to the person you are calling and back.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Lokaci wani abu ne wanda yake kewaye da mu, kuma yana shafan duk abin da muke yi, duk da haka yana da wuyar fahimta. Masana, kama daga na addini, masu falsafa da masana kimiyya sun yi shekaru dubbai su na nazari a kan Lokaci. Muna wayar lokaci a matsayin wani jeri na abubuwan da ke wucewa daga zamani na gaba ta cikin zamanin yanzu zuwa zamanin baya. Wata fassarar ta lokaci ita ce yadda mu ke kwatanta tsawon faruwar wasu abubuwa. Za ka iya ƙayyade wucewar lokaci da kanka ta hanyar dubawa maimaitawaar wani al'amura mai juyawa. Wani al'amura mai juawa wani abu ne da yake faruwa akai-akai ne.
mt: Time is something that surrounds us, and permeates everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Scientists, from religion to philosophy to physics, have spent decades studying Time. We view Time as a sequence of events from the present into the future within the current era. You can measure the passage of Time by counting the repetitions of a repeating event. A repeating event is something that happens over and over again.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: A al’adance dai, wanda zai gaji sarautar kai tsaye zai tafi ne ga sojoji bayan kammala makaranta. Duk da haka, Charles ya halarci jami'ar Trinity College, Cambridge inda ya karanci Ilimin Al’ummomi da Al’adu wato Anthropology and Archaeology da kuma Ilimin Nazarin Kayan Tarihi, kuma daga bisani Tarihi, ya sami digiri na 2:2 (digiri ajin ƙasa na biyu). Charles shi ne memba na farko cikin dangin Sarauta na Burtaniya da aka ba shi digiri.
mt: Traditionally, the heir apparent would succeed to the throne immediately upon the death of the monarch. However, Charles attended Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology and then History, and from there he received a 2:2 (second class lower division) degree. Charles is the first member of the British Royal Family to receive a university degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: A al’adance dai, wanda zai gaji sarautar kai tsaye zai tafi ne ga sojoji bayan kammala makaranta. Duk da haka, Charles ya halarci jami'ar Trinity College, Cambridge inda ya karanci Ilimin Al’ummomi da Al’adu wato Anthropology and Archaeology da kuma Ilimin Nazarin Kayan Tarihi, kuma daga bisani Tarihi, ya sami digiri na 2:2 (digiri ajin ƙasa na biyu). Charles shi ne memba na farko cikin dangin Sarauta na Burtaniya da aka ba shi digiri.
mt: Traditionally, the heir apparent would succeed to the throne immediately upon the death of the monarch. However, Charles attended Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology and then History, and from there he received a 2:2 (second class lower division) degree. Charles is the first member of the British Royal Family to receive a university degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: England ta fuskanci doguwar lokacin salama bayan ta sake karbe iko daga Danelaw. Duk da haka a 991 Ethelred ta fuskanci anobar jirgi mai saukar ungulu wace ta fi kowace girma tun karnin Guthrum baya. Wannan kwambar jiragen ruwan yaƙi ta kasance karkashin jagorancin Olaf Trygvasson, dan kasar Norway da ke da burin ƙwato kasarsa daga danniyar kasar Denmark. Bayan koma bayan soja da aka samu da farko, Ethelred ya sami daidaituwa da Olaf, wanda ya koma Norway domin kokarin kwato masarautar sa, wadda ya sami nasara a wani wajen amma a wani wajen bai samu ba.
mt: 991 England faced a period of peace after recovering control from the Danelaw. However, in 991 Ethelred faced the largest Viking raid ever, surpassing any since the reign of Guthrum before. This raid was part of a naval war under the leadership of Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who sought to conquer his own country from the powerful Danish kingdom. After initial military success, Ethelred made peace with Olaf, who returned to Norway to attempt to conquer his own kingdom, which he succeeded in doing in one battle but failed in another.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: A wajejen ƙarni na 15, arewacin Estonia yana ƙarƙashin tasirin al’adu na ƙasar Jamus. Wasu malaman addini na Germany sun so su kawo Allah kusa da mutanen asali, saboda haka suka kirkiro yaren Estonia. Ta sanadiyar harafin Jamusanci kuma an ƙara harafi ɗaya “Õ / õ”. Yayin da zamani ya yi nisa, yawancin kalmomin da aka aro daga Jamusanci sun haɗe. Wannan shi ne farko zamanin wayewa.
mt: 15 centuries ago, Estonia was under the influence of German culture. Some German religious leaders said that they should bring God closer to the natives, so they created the Estonian language. Due to the German letter, one more letter “Õ / õ” was added. As time passed, most words adopted from German. This is the first time in the history of the world.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Akwai mabambantan kiyasi na yawan mutanen da ke jin harshen Hindi. An ƙiyasta cewa yana tsakanin harshe na biyu zuwa na hudu cikin yarukan da aka fi amfani da su a duniya. Adadin masu magana da yaren ya bambanta dangane da ko an ƙidaya yaruka masu alaƙa da juna. Kimantawa ta masu magana ta kama daga miliyan 340 zuwa miliyan 500, kuma kusan mutane miliyan 800 ne ke iya fahimtar yaren. Hindi da Urdu sun yi kama a kalmomi amma daban a rubutu; a tattaunawar yau da kullun, masu magana da harsunan biyu na iya fahimtar junan su.
mt: Estimates of the number of people who speak Hindi vary. It is ranked between the second and fourth most spoken language in the world. The number of speakers includes those who are fluent in both Hindi and Urdu. The two languages are mutually intelligible in conversation, but differ in writing; in everyday conversation, speakers of both languages can understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangeul shine kadai huruffi wadda aka kirkira kuma ake amfani da shi kullum. An kirkiro haruffin ne a 1444 a zamanin mulkin Sarki Sejong (1418 - 1450). Sarki Sajong shi ne sarki na huɗu a Daular Joseon kuma ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda aka fi ji da su. Asali ya sakawa haruffan Hangeul sunan Hunmin Jeongeum, wanda ke nufin “haruffa da su ka dace wajen koyar da mutane.
mt: Hangeul is the only alphabet that was created and used at the same time. The alphabet was created in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 - 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and one of the most well-known. Originally, the Hangeul alphabet was called Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the proper sounds for instructing the people."
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Akwai hasashe da yawa kan yadda aka sami harshen Sanskrit. Ɗaya daga cikinsu shine game da hijirar jinsin Aryaniyawa daga yamma zuwa India waɗanda suka zo da yarensu. Sanskrit tsohon harshe ne wanda za a iya kwatantawa da harshen Latin da ake magana da shi a Turai. Littafin farko da aka sani a duniya an rubuta shi da Sanskrit. Bayan an haɗa Upanishads, sai Sanskrit ya ɓace saboda matsayi. Sanskrit yare ne mai fadi da kuma mai wadatar gaske, wanda ya zama tushen harsunan Indiya da yawa na zamani, kamar dai Latin shine tushen harsunan Turai kamar Faransanci da yaran spanish.
mt: There are many theories on the origin of the Sanskrit language. One of them is that the Aryans came from the west to India with their language. Sanskrit is the oldest language known to be written. After the Upanishads, Sanskrit disappeared because of its position. Sanskrit is a wide and deep language, which is the source of many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source of many modern European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Ta yaya ne nauyin lo zai ja ni? Idan ku ka tsaya a farfajiyan Io, nauyin ku ba zai kai nauyin ku na kan duniyarmu ba. Mutum mai nauyin fam 200 (90kg) a duniya zai yi kimanin fam 36 (16kg) a kan Io. Don haka nauyi, ba shakka, yana jan ƙasa akan ku.
mt: How much will I weigh? If you stand on Io, your weight will not be your weight on Earth. A 200-pound (90kg) person on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So weight, undoubtedly, is pulling you down.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Farfajiyan wata yana da duwatsu da kura. Ana kiran shimfidar wajen wata crust. Kaurin shimfiɗar saman ƙasa ya kai 70 km a gefen kusa da kaurin 100 km a gefen nesa. Yana da sirinta a ƙarƙashin maria kuma ya fi kauri a ƙarƙashin tsaunuka. Za a iya samun ƙarin maria a gefen kusa saboda bangon siriri ne. Abu ne mai sauƙi narkakken dutse ya tashi zuwa saman.
mt: The earthquake was felt as far as 70 km from the epicenter. The crust is being pushed up. The earthquake was felt more strongly in the mountains than in the plains. There may be more aftershocks because the fault is locked. It is easy to see the cracks in the ground rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Mutane da yawa suna tunanin ranar da ɗan adam zai iya tafiya zuwa wata tauraruwa domin bincika wasu duniyoyi, wasu mutane suna mamakin abin da ke can wasu sun gaskata cewa akwai bakon tsararin sama ko wasu rayuwa da ke akwai a wata duniya. Amma, idan wannan ya taɓa faruwa tabbas ba zai faru na dogon lokaci ba. Taurari sun bazu sosai cewa akwai miliyoyin mil tsakanin taurari waɗanda “maƙwabta” ne. Wataƙila wata rana, ‘ya’yan jikokinka za su tsaya a kan duniyar baƙin halittu suna mamaki game da magabatansu na zamanin baya?
mt: Many people believe that one day man will travel to a starship to explore other worlds, some people are amazed that there are intelligent life forms or other life on another planet. But if this happens, it will not happen for a long time. Starships have spread that there are millions of stars that are “neighbors”. One day, the children of the future will stand on the planet of intelligent life forms, amazed at their ancestors of the past?
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Rana ba ta da abi haskakawa kamar Duniyar wanda za ka tsaye a kai. Duka ranar ya keru ne dan nauyin gas, wuta, da kuma sinadarin plasma. Iskar gas in yana zama siriri yayin da kake kara nisa daga tsakiyar rana. Bangaren da muke gani idan muka kalli Rana ana kiran sa photosphere, wanda yake nufin “kwallon haske”.
mt: The day is not as bright as the Sun, which you would stand in front of. All day is made of gas, fire, and plasma. The gas is transparent as it gets farther from the center of the day. The part we see when we look at the day is called the photosphere, which means “bright wall”.
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Kimanin shekaru dubu uku bayan haka, a cikin 1610, masanin Falaki ɗan ƙasar Italiya Galileo Galilei ya yi amfani da na’urar hangen nesa don lura cewa Venus tana da matakai, kamar yadda wata yake yi. Hanyoyi suna faruwa saboda kawai gefen Venus (ko na Wata) da ke fuskantar Rana yana haske. Matakan Venus sun goyi bayan ka'idar Copernicus cewa duniyoyin suna zagaya Rana. Sai kuma a sheakaru kalilian bayan haka a shekarar 1639, wani masanin ililmin taurari dan kasar Ingila mai suna Jeremiah Horrocks ya gano motsin tauraron Venus.
mt: 400 years ago, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus had phases, as a planet does. Phases occur because only the side of Venus (or a planet) facing the Sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that planets orbit the Sun. And 40 years later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks discovered the motion of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Ƙoramar Amazon ita ce ƙorama ta biyu mafi tsawo kuma mafi girma a Duniya. Tana ɗaukar ruwa fiye da sau 8 a matsayin babbar ƙorama ta biyu. Amazon kuma shine kogi mafi fadi a Duniya, a wasu lokutan nisan mil shida. Cikakken kashi 20 cikin dari na ruwan da ke zubowa daga koramun duniyar zuwa cikin teku yana zuwa ne daga Amazon. Babbar Ƙoramar Amazon ta na da nisan 6,387 km (3,980 mil). Tana karbar ruwa daga dubban kananan ƙoramu.
mt: The Amazon is the second longest river and the largest river by volume in the world. It carries more than half of all the water discharged into ocean. The Amazon basin includes part of Colombia and Venezuela. The Amazon, which has about one-fifth of all the flowing water on Earth, is 4,000 miles (6,400 km) long. The Amazon River basin contains more than half of the world's remaining rain forests. The Amazon River is the world's largest river by volume, and it discharges huge amounts of sediment into the Atlantic Ocean. The Amazon River is the world's second longest river after the Nile River. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

The Amazon River is the world's largest river by volume, and it discharges huge amounts of sediment into the Atlantic Ocean.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Kashi goma sha takwas na ƴan Venezuela ba su da aiki, kuma mafi yawan waɗanda ke da aiki suna aiki ne a kananan masana’antu. Kashi biyu bisa uku na mutanen Venezuela na aiki ne a sashen ma’aikatu, daya bisa hudu kuma na aiki a masana’antu,sai kashi daya cikin biyar da ke noma. Wata muhimmiyar masana'antu ga 'yan Venezuela ita ce mai, inda ƙasar ta kasance mai fitar da kayayyaki zuwa ƙasashe, kodayake kashi ɗaya cikin ɗari ne ke aiki a masana'antar mai.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal sector. Two-thirds of Venezuelans work in the public sector, one-third in the informal sector, and one in five in agriculture. One of the most important industries for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a major exporter, although one in ten works in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Taurari suna fitar da wuta da zafi saboda karfin da aka samo yayin da aka hada sinadarin Hydrogen da kwayoyin zarra (ko aka hada) tare domin haifar abubuwa masu nauyi. Masana kimiyya suna aiki don ƙirƙirar wata na’ura da za ta sarrafa makamashi ta irin wannan hanya. Wannan, duk da haka, matsala ce mai matuƙar wahalar warwarewa kuma zai ɗauki shekaru da yawa kafin mu ga an gina na’urori haɗaka masu amfani.
mt: Combustion and heat are being released due to the energy found when combining Hydrogen and Carbon (or combining) to form heavy products. Scientists are working on creating a device that will harness this energy. This, however, is a very difficult problem to solve and will take years before we see devices that can combine.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Daidaikun sinadarai ko dunkulensu na iya canza yanayi ba tare da sun canza ba a karan kansu. Nitrogen a matsayin gas har yanzu yana da sinadarai iri ɗaya kamar nitrogen na ruwa. Yanayin ruwa ya fi yawa amma kwayoyin sun kasance iri ɗaya. Ruwa ma wani misali ne. Mahadin ruwa ya kunshi ƙwayoyin halitta biyu na sinadarin hydrogen da ƙwayar halittar oxygen daya. Yana da siffa iri guda ko da kuwa iska ce ko ruwa-ruwa ko kuma ma abu mai kauri. Kodayake yanayin jikinta na iya canzawa, yanayin sinadaran ba ya canja wa.
mt: 2. Compounds or their elements can change conditions without changing themselves. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same elements as nitrogen water. The state of water is different but the elements are the same. Water is an example. The water molecule consists of two elements of the hydrogen element and one element of the oxygen element. It has one form or another whether it is air or water or even a solid. Although my condition can change, the condition of the elements does not change.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: A lokacin Yaƙin Juyin Juya Hali, jihohi goma sha ukun sun kafa gwamnatin tsakiya mai rauni - wadda ta kunshi Majalisa kawai - a ƙarƙashin dokar gwamnatin hadin gwiwa. Majalisa ba ta da wani iko na kakaba haraji, sannan kuma, kasancewar babu ɓangarorin zartaswa da na shari’a na ƙasar, ta dogara ne kan hukumomin jihohi, waɗanda mafi yawanci ba sa bayar da haɗin kai, wajen ganin an tilasta aiki da dokokin. Hakanan ba ta da ikon yin watsi da dokokin haraji da haraji tsakanin jihohi. Labaran sun buƙaci yarjejeniya baki ɗaya daga dukkan jihohin kafin a iya gyara su kuma jihohi sun ɗauki gwamnatin tarraya a sauƙaƙe cewa wakilansu ba su nan.
mt: During the Civil War, nine states formed a central government of limited power - a Congress with only one chamber - under the Articles of Confederation. Congress had no power to levy taxes, and, lacking a judiciary and a national executive, it relied on the states, which often refused to cooperate, to enforce its laws. It also lacked the power to invalidate state laws or taxes between states. Reports required a unanimous agreement from all states before it could be amended, and states took the government at face value that their representatives were not.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: Idan ka kalli majigi mai suna National Treasure, za ka yi tsamanin an rubuta taswirar taska a bayan takardan Ƙudurin ‘Yancin Kai. Sai dai kuma, wannan ba gaskiya ba ne. Duk da cewa akwai wani abu da aka rubuta a bayan daftarin, ba taswirar taskar arziki ba ce. An rubuta a bayan Bayanin Samun 'Yancin kai kalmomin “Asalin Sanarwar Samun' Yanci ne a ranar 4 ga Yuli 1776”. Rubutun ya bayyana a ƙasan takardar, juye. A yayin da babu takamaiman wanda ya rubuta shi, an sani cewa a farkon rayuwar shi, babban takardan (yana daukar ma'aunin inci 29¾ zuwa inci 24½) an nada shi don ajiya. Don haka, da alama an ƙara tsarin rubutun ne kawai a matsayin laƙabi.
mt: If you call the office of National Treasure, you will hear a recording of the Declaration of Independence. But that's not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not the Declaration of Independence. It is written on the back of the Declaration of Independence, "Original Declaration of Independence July 4, 1776." The writing is on the back of the document, moves. While there is no one who wrote it, it is known that in the early years of his life, the main document (which measures 29¾ inches to 24½ inches) was assigned to store. So, it is only the writing of the arrangement as a label.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: A farko farkon samun yanci, kwarewar masana lambu na kasar Singapore sun taimaka wajen maida ta tsibiri mai cike da tsirrai a yanki mai zafin yanayi. A shekarar 1981, an zaɓi furen Vanda Miss Joaquim, wanda ake samarwa ta barbara a gona, a matsayin furen ƙasa.
mt: Ɗan ƙasar Singapore na farko, ƙwarewar masana lambu sun taimaka wajen maida ta tsibiri mai cike da tsirrai a yanki mai zafin yanayi. A shekarar 1981, an zaɓi furen Vanda Miss Joaquim, wanda ake samarwa ta barbara a gona, a matsayin furen ƙasa.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Ko da yake ginin dala a cikin dutse ya ci gaba har zuwa ƙarshen tsohuwar Masarautar, dala ta Giza ba a taɓa wuce ta da girmansu da ƙwarewar fasaha na ginin su ba. Sabuwar Daula ta daulolin baya na Misra su na yaba yadda kakanninsu su ka giggina abubuwa na tarihi, wadanda ko a wancan lokacin sun haura shekaru dubu.
mt: Although the pyramids in the Giza plateau have continued to the end of the Old Kingdom, the Great Pyramid of Giza has never been surpassed in size or engineering sophistication by any of its successors in the New Kingdom. The New Kingdom pharaohs were proud of their ancestors' achievements, which they considered to be the pinnacle of their civilization.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Kowace shekara a watan Oktoba kusan dabbobi masu cin ciyawa miliyan 1.5 suke tafiya zuwa tuddan kudu, suna ƙetare Kogin Mara, daga tuddan arewa don ruwan sama. Daga nan koma arewa ta hanyar yamma, sake tsallake kogin Mara, bayan ruwan sama a wajen watan Afrilu. Yankin Serengeti yana dauke da wajen shakatawa na Serengeti, Yankin Kiyayewa na Ngorongoro da wajen Keɓe Namomin Daji na Maswa a Tanzania da ma wajen namun daji na kasa a Kenya.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate south every October, crossing the Mara River from the north to the water. They then head west, crossing the Mara again after the rains in April. The Serengeti ecosystem includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, the Maswa Game Reserve and the Maasai Mara Game Reserve.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Tare da yakin Faransa, Jamus ta fara shirin mamaye tsibirin Biritaniya. Lambar-sirri ta Jamus ta sanya wa harin suna “Operation Sealion”. Yawancin manyan makamai da kayan sojojin Burtaniya sun ɓace lokacin da aka kwashe su daga Dunkirk, don haka sojojin ba su da ƙarfi. Amma Rundunar Sojojin ruwa na Sarauta na da ƙarfi sosai fiye da rundunar sojojin ruwan Jamus (“Kriegsmarine”) kuma da ya salwantar da duk wani mamayewar jirgin ruwan da aka aika ƙetaren hanyar ruwan Ingila. Kodayake, jiragen ruwan Birtaniya kalilan ne su ke kusa da hanyoyin da ake tsammanin za’a kawo farmaki saboda shugabannin sojan na tsoron sojojin Jamus na iya nutsar da su.
mt: With the Battle of France, Germany began planning to invade the British island. The German code name for the attack was “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy equipment was evacuated from Dunkirk, leaving the British Army without sufficient strength. However, the Royal Navy was much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could easily repel any sea invasion along the English Channel. However, the British Navy was also close to the routes that were expected to be used for the invasion because the German Army commanders were afraid of the British Navy.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: Bari mu fara da bayani game da shirye-shiryen Italiya. Italiya ta kasance “kanin” na Jamus da Japan. Tana da rundunar sojan ƙasa da na ruwa marasa ƙarfi, duk da cewa sun kera sabbin jiragen ruwa guda hudu kafin barkewar yakin. Babban burin Italiya shine kasashen Afirka. Domin mamayar waɗannan ƙasashen, suna buƙatar samun wajen tara sojoji ta yadda rundunoninsu zasu iya ratsa tekun Bahr Rum su mamaye Afirka. Don hakan, dole ne su kawar da sansanoni da jiragen ruwan Birtaniya a Masar. Bayan waɗancan ayyukan, ba a tsammanin jiragen ruwan yaƙi na Italiya su yi wani abu kuma. Yanzu ga Japan. Japan ƙasa ce tsibiri, kamar Biritaniya.
mt: Let's start with Italy's plans. Italy was the "junior" of Germany and Japan. It had a weak army and navy, despite having built four new warships before the war. Italy's main goal was to conquer Africa. To achieve this, they needed to gather troops so that they could cross the Red Sea and conquer Africa. To do this, they had to defeat the British warships in Egypt. After these actions, it was not expected that the Italian warships would do anything else. Now to Japan. Japan is an island country, like Britain.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: Saukar D-Day da yaƙe-yaƙe masu zuwa sun 'yantar da arewacin Faransa, amma har yanzu kudanci bai sami yanci ba. Faransawa '' Vichy '' suka mallake shi. Waɗannan mutanen Faransa ne waɗanda suka yi sulhu da Jamusawa a 1940 kuma suka yi aiki tare da masu mamaye maimakon yaƙar su. A ranar 15 ga watan Agusta 1940, Kawayen sun mamaye kudancin Faransa, mamayar da aka yi wa lakabi da sunan “Operation Dragoon”. A cikin makonni biyu kawai Amurkawa da Sojojin Faransa na 'yancin faransa suka 'yantar da kudancin Faransa kuma suka juya zuwa Jamus.
mt: 1944's D-Day and ensuing battles liberated France's east, but its south still remained under Nazi occupation. The French "Vichy" had made peace with the Germans and worked with the occupiers instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, an invasion dubbed "Operation Dragoon". In just two months, American and Free French forces liberated southern France and pushed back into Germany.
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: Saukar D-Day da yaƙe-yaƙe masu zuwa sun 'yantar da arewacin Faransa, amma har yanzu kudanci bai sami yanci ba. Faransawa '' Vichy '' suka mallake shi. Waɗannan mutanen Faransa ne waɗanda suka yi sulhu da Jamusawa a 1940 kuma suka yi aiki tare da masu mamaye maimakon yaƙar su. A ranar 15 ga watan Agusta 1940, Kawayen sun mamaye kudancin Faransa, mamayar da aka yi wa lakabi da sunan “Operation Dragoon”. A cikin makonni biyu kawai Amurkawa da Sojojin Faransa na 'yancin faransa suka 'yantar da kudancin Faransa kuma suka juya zuwa Jamus.
mt: 1944's D-Day and ensuing battles liberated France's east, but its south still remained under Nazi occupation. The French "Vichy" had made peace with the Germans and worked with the occupiers instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, an invasion dubbed "Operation Dragoon". In just two months, American and Free French forces liberated southern France and pushed back into Germany.
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: An tsara Jiragen ƙarkashin ruwa jiragen ruwa domin yin tafiya a ƙarkashin ruwa, kuma su kasance a can na wani dogon lokaci. An yi amfani da jiragen yaƙi masu tafiya a ƙarƙashin ruwa a Yaƙin Duniya na I da Yaƙin Duniya na II. A can baya ba su da sauri kuma ba su iya harbi mai nisa. A farkon yakin galibi suna tafiya akan saman teku, amma yayin da kimiyyar radar ta kara haɓaka, kwarancewa ta samu soasai yadda jiragen karkashin teku basu da zabi dole sai sun yi nutso yadda ba za’a iya ganin su ba. Ana kiran jiragen ruwa masu nutso na kasar Jamus da sunan U-Boats. Jamusawa sun iya tukawa da sarrafa wadannan jirage nasu. Saboda nasarar da suke samu da jirage masu tafiya a ƙarƙashin ruwa, bayan yakin ba a yarda Jamusawa suna da su da yawa ba.
mt: Submarines are ships that travel underwater, and are usually in a place for a long time. They were used in World War I and World War II. At first they were slow and could not travel far. At the beginning of the war they were usually on the surface of the water, but as radar technology improved, they became so stealthy that they could not be seen. The German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were able to build and control these submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war the Germans were allowed to keep many of them.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: Ya zuwa 17 ga Satumba, 1939, tsaron Poland ya riga ya karye, kuma fatan kawai da ake da shi shine na janyewa sannan a sake shiri a kan tozon gadar Romania. Koda yake wannan shiri ya tashi daga aiki dare ɗaya, yayin da sama da sojoji 800,000 na tarayyar Soviet su ka shiga Belarus da Ukraine inda su ka shata fagen daga bayan mamayar kasar Poland wanda ya karya yarjejeniyar sulhu da aka yi a Riga, sulhu zaman lafiya na kasashen Soviet da Poland da ma wasu yarjeniyoyin na kasashen duniya tsakanin kasarshe biyu ko fiye da haka.
mt: 17 September 1939, Poland's defenses had already been breached, and the only hope was to retreat across the Romanian bridgehead. Despite this, the news came from one day's work, while more than 800,000 troops of the Soviet Union were entering Belarus and Ukraine where they were to take the offensive after the Polish invasion that had breached the peace treaty and the peace treaty between the two countries and other international treaties.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: Abubuwa ba suyi kyau ba ga yan Italia a Arewacin Afirka kusan tun daga farko. A cikin mako guda da sanarwar yakin Italiya a ranar 10 ga Yuni, 1940, Turawan Birtaniyya na 11 sun kame Fort Capuzzo a Libya. A wani harin kwanton-bauna da ke gabashin Bardia, Turawan ingila sun kame Babban Injiniyan Soja na Italia, Janar Lastucci. A ranar 28 ga Yuni, aka kashe Marshal Italo Balbo, Gwamna-Janar na Libya kuma magaji ga Mussolini, ta hanyar kuskuren harbi yayin da yake sauka a Tobruk.
mt: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa since the beginning. In the first day of the war, on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Division captured Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In a bombing raid east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Army's Chief Engineer, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, Governor-General of Libya and Mussolini's successor, was killed in an accident while landing in Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: Buddhist na Tibet ya dogara ne da koyarwar Buddha, amma hanyar mahayana da ta hanyar fasahar India da yawa sun ninka ta. A bisa ƙa’ida Budancin Tibet yana da sauƙi. Ya kunshi tsarin motsa jiki na Yoga, kadaicewa domin tunani da kuma bin tafarkin son kowa da komai. Da Kundalini Yoga an samar da kuzarin Kundalini (kuzarin wayarwa da kai) an farka ta hanyar motsawar jiki, motsawar nufanci, mantras da ganin wa. Ginshiƙen tunanun Tibetan shi ne Abin Bauta Yoga. Duk da yake kafafen gani na abubuwan bauta daban-daban hanyoyin makamashi an tsaftace su, akan buɗe chakras inda ake ƙirƙirar tunanin wayewa.
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but the Mahayana and Vajrayana paths of Indian influence have surpassed it.  Tibetan Buddhism is easy to follow. It includes a system of physical exercises, abstaining from thinking and focusing on the welfare of all beings.  Kundalini Yoga was created by Kundalini (energy awakening) through physical exercises, mental exercises, mantras and seeing.  Tibetan meditation is the Secret Yoga. Although the various forms of the secret of the secret are different ways of practice, they are purified, opened chakras where the energy is created.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga. In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love. With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.

src: An fara shirin da karfe 8:30 na yamma (15.00 UTC). Shahararun mawaka a faɗin ƙasar sun gabatar da bhajans, ko wakokin ibada, zuw ga kafafun Shri Sham. Mawaki Sarju Sharma, shi ya fara a maraicen sannan sai Shankar Choudhary ya biyo baya da Chhappan Bhog Bhajan ya biyo su. Mawaki, Raju Khandelwal yana raka shi. Sannan, sai Lakkha Singh ya yi jagora a rera waƙar bhajans. Farantai 108 na Chhappan Bhog (a Indiyanci, kayan abinci daban-daban gud 56, kamar, Alewa, 'ya'yan itace, masu kwanso, abinci da sauran su waɗanda aka bayar ga abin bauta) ga Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh ya kuma gabatar da Chhappan Bhog Bhajan. Singer da Raju Khandelwal yana rakiyarsa.
mt: 8:30 pm (15.00 UTC). Famous singers from across the country performed bhajans, or devotional songs, in praise of Shri Sham. Singer Sarju Sharma began the bhajans, followed by Shankar Choudhary, who then performed Chhappan Bhog Bhajan, followed by Raju Khandelwal. Lakkha Singh then led the bhajans. 108 Chhappan Bhog (in Hindi, various foods totaling 56, such as almonds, 'ya'yan itace, masu kwanso, food and other items offered to the deity) for Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh also performed Chhappan Bhog Bhajan. Singer Raju Khandelwal led the bhajans.
ref: The program started at 8:30 p.m. local time (15.00 UTC). Famous singers across the country presented bhajans, or devotional songs, to Shri Shyam's feet. Singer Sanju Sharma started the evening, followed by Jai Shankar Choudhary. esented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him. Then, Lakkha Singh took the lead in singing the bhajans. 108 plates of Chhappan Bhog (in Hinduism, 56 different edible items, like, sweets, fruits, nuts, dishes etc. which are offered to deity) were served to Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh presented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him.

src: Bikin ya fara da nuni na musamman daga mashahuriyar kungiyar nan ta duniya Cirque du Soleil. Ya cigaba da kungiyar waka ta Istanbul wato Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra a Janissary, daga cikin dakarun masarauta, da mawakan kungiyar Fatih Erkoç da Müslüm Gürses. Daga nan Muridai Masu Juyi suka shiga fagen. Shahararriyar mawaƙiyar Turkiyya Sezen Aksu ta yi waƙa tare da mawaƙin tenor ɗan ƙasar Italiya Alessandro Safina da kuma mawakin Girka Haris Alexiou. Domin kammala shirin, kungiyar rawa daga Turkiya wato Fire of Anatolia sun yi wasan su na shirin “Troy”.
mt: The event began with a special performance by the world-famous Cirque du Soleil. It continued with the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra in Janissary, one of the city's most famous orchestras, and the group's singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses. The Murids then took the stage. Turkish superstar Sezen Aksu sang with Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. The event ended with a performance by the Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia in their show "Troy".
ref: "The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil. It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses. Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage. Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show ""Troy""."
